Company overview
MDLand International (MDLand) is a leading innovative health information technology company based in New York providing cloud-based certified electronic health records, a data-driven population health platform, a culturally competent patient engagement, and emerging digital health solutions to practices and healthcare organizations.

At MDLand, we have experienced a substantial period of growth and profitability as a result of our hard work to serve community-based private practices and physician organizations. Our global team is working together to refine our product offering to help customers' transformation in value-based care and the digital health world.

As a health technology company, we will bring the promise of better technologies with solutions to today's and tomorrow's healthcare problems. Our value system with unyielding principles in integrity, quality, and openness will guide us bravely in taking every innovative step and being a trailblazer to refocus on humanity in today's tech-enabled healthcare world. Together, we are making a difference for better healthcare - and you can, too. Become an MDLander.

Novocol Pharma is a growing contract development and manufacturing organization (CDMO), specialized in sterile injectable cartridge and combination product manufacturing. We strive for excellence and customer-centricity to deliver value to global pharmaceutical clients through contract services for drug development and commercial manufacturing. With over 40 years in operation, our team of 400 employees and modern facilities, located in Cambridge, Ontario provide a personalized and responsive experience for our customers. Our employees are our number one asset! We offer developmental opportunities, excellent compensation and benefit programs, discounted gym memberships, work/life balance programs, employee recognition, social events, and spirit days.

We are a proud member of the Septodont group of companies. Septodont is a pharmaceutical and medical device company with a global leadership position in dental pain management. The group counts over 1800 employees worldwide and has remained a 100% family-owned company for over 85 years. Our Cambridge facility serves as a significant manufacturing site within the Septodont group with high volume dental anesthetic production for a global customer base.

The IT Digital Workplace Co-op reports to the IT Leader, Digital Workplace & IT Systems and assists in the implementation and configuration of identity management and security, collaboration tools, device management, application, and database services.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
eSentire, Inc., is the authority in Managed Detection and Response Services, protecting the critical data and applications of 1000+ organizations in 70+ countries from known and unknown cyber threats. Our mission is to hunt, investigate and stop cyber threats before they become business disrupting events. Combining cutting-edge machine learning embedded in our XDR platform, with human expertise, and proven security operations leadership, eSentire is able to find and stop attackers, and minimize the impact to our customers.

eSentire delivers broad-scale security to our customers, utilizing a vast array of underlying data sources. To be able to harness the value in all that data, we need to make it usable - usable to other data consumers, usable to ML algorithms, and usable to human security analysts. This is hard: to take all the chaos within that data, and turn it into clarity that helps protect our customers. We need an expert technical and people leader who can tackle this challenge - aiding the team that is building web services and applications that make ML work at scale for the end user.

What We Offer
  • Work with talented engineers: You will have the opportunity to work with some of the best in their fields in multiple domains.
  • Increase your skill set: Grow as an engineer by working with emerging technologies, in a high demand industry segment.
  • Drive Product Direction: Work for a company that encourages input from all levels to help shape the final product.
  • Work / Life Balance: Often promised but often ignored: At eSentire we really do work with our employees to find that sweet-spot that integrates a rewarding work and personal life.
Role Overview
eSentire is currently seeking a Full Stack Software Developer Co-op to join our Detection & Incident Response (IR) Development team. We are developing our IR platform to empower eSentire's business growth. We develop central data models, data resources, and metrics that are critical to our business. As part of this team, you will work on development of scalable and robust data workflows that empowers cybersecurity platform.

  • Python development
  • Typescript or JavaScript development
  • unit testing
  • AWS, Terraform, git, Jenkins, Vuejs, HTML, bootstrap, SCSS, bash
  • Self-motivated (remote-working team)
  • Keen to learn new technologies and languages
  • Enjoy working in a fast-paced environment
  • Like to write well-structured, clean, and maintainable code
  • Can work well with others and follow instructions/guidance from team members
  • Can work well on their own to debug/find solutions

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
About Us
Tarteel was founded with one mission: to strengthen the relationship Muslims have with the Quran. This goal has been at the very heart of Tarteel since its creation, and we continue to strive to provide the proper tools to empower the Muslim ummah to better connect with the words of Allah SWT, nourishing their faith in doing so.

Inspired by the Islamic Golden Age, we saw untapped potential in the area of religious technology. We built Tarteel to help Muslims improve their Quranic study using the best digital tools. The Quran is a journey, and Tarteel is your companion.

Tarteel has more than 10M downloads, state of the art models, and relationships with leading AI companies such as Nvidia, who has us as a featured customer: https://www.nvidia.com/en-us/case-studies/automating-real-time-arabic-speech-recognition/.

What we're looking for
In this role, you will help design, build, and maintain our mobile application. Our mobile app is built with React Native, including some native modules. We're also currently exploring making use of Kotlin Multiplatform for certain performance-critical tasks. Because we build most features in Tarteel to work offline, the kind of challenges you will get to solve will push the limits of your skillset and expose you to challenges you haven't previously encountered. If you have a background in mobile development (especially with React Native) and a passion for building high-quality software, we want to hear from you!

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
The Service Desk Specialist reports to the Service Desk Supervisor and Service Desk Manager and is part of a student team providing front-line technical support and customer service to the University of Waterloo community. You will gain experience with network troubleshooting, software troubleshooting, printer and basic hardware troubleshooting, authentication problems, the opportunity to work on interesting projects, provide feedback to IST, and more! Service Desk Specialists must have the ability to problem solve and deal with technical problems brought to them by clients visiting the IST Service Desks.

IST Client Services in collaboration with Waterloo Residences and the Library provides technical support and services to all students and staff. In order to provide accessible, convenient support for our clients, the Library and Residence Service Desks are operated by both part time and full time student staff. The Service Desk Specialist is required to work full time hours (35 hours per week) at the Service Desk at one of our three locations (V1, DC, DP). It is extremely important for the Service Desk Specialist to be able to adapt to a changing and fast paced technical environment. To further this goal, working with other areas in IST and the faculty help desks is required. The Service Desk Specialist is also required to work amongst a team of part time student staff (Student Computing Consultants). To be successful in this role, you will need to possess great customer service skills, be committed and willing to learn new things, and work well amongst a team and independently.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Loudmouth Security is looking for students passionate about cyber security to join their team of Ethical Hackers. Prior ethical hacking experience is not required, but is certainly an asset.

Tasks may include:
  • Assisting in vulnerabliity assessments, vulnerability research and penetration testing exercises
  • Developing tooling to assist in vulnerability research
  • Collaborating on assessment reports and other deliverables
Relevant experience:
  • Participated in Capture the Flag competitions
  • Solved multiple challenges on Hack the Box or Try Hack Me
  • Have used or enforced secure development practices
  • Familiarity with OWASP Top 10
  • Firm understanding of network technologies and protocols
  • Have performed network administration activities
  • Have previous experience in security incident response
  • If you have competed in any CTFs or solved any Hack the Box or Try Hack Me challenges, please provide any solution write-ups that you have written. Please also provide a link to your Github (or other) source repository for any open source projects you have developed or contributed to.

About Loudmouth Security
Loudmouth Security was established in 2016 and has quickly become one of Ottawa's elite cyber security consultancies. Operated by two Defcon Black Badge winners, Loudmouth performs offensive security assessments that demonstrate what a hacker could do to your organization. We bring awareness to the weaknesses and breakdowns in your cyber security defenses.

Our team consists of Offensive Security Certified Professionals with a wealth of experience in penetration testing, vulnerability assessments, red-teaming, social engineering, physical security, and SCADA security. Our clients include federal government departments, municipalities, crown corporations, and private corporations in various industries including health care, defense contracting, finance, business solutions, and manufacturing.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Position Overview:
Join us as a Unity Developer Intern and play a pivotal role in bringing PC RTS game SuperColony to life. Working under our Senior Developer, you'll support the content team by developing game mechanics, modifying pathfinding and utility AI algorithms, improving the user interfaces, and ensuring the game runs smoothly. This role is ideal for a current student with Unity and C# coding experience looking to gain practical industry experience in an indie game team.

About Company:
Antic Games, a remote-first indie game studio based in Vancouver, BC, thrives on creative collaboration. We're currently pouring our collective talents into SuperColony, our debut title for PC and Console supported by Canada Media Fund (CMF).
SuperColony is a real-time ant colony simulation game set in the hostile world of insects. The game features a complex collective ant colony behavior and its ability to survive in the ever-changing environment. Players start with a small ant colony and will build their anthill, harvest resources, and attack with armies to clear out areas of the map. The player's ant colony is unique in that it can direct its evolution. To expand and overcome the hostile environment, players would need to construct new castes with special abilities.
We invite you to become a key part of an aspiring indie studio, improving the gaming experience for our players, while wearing multiple creative hats.

Bonus Skills:
  • Familiarity with game development and design principles.
  • Knowledge of UI development and shaders within Unity.
  • Interest in RTS, strategy, or simulation games.

Job Summary

Passionate about software development? Want exposure to the ins and outs of investments and the myriad systems that make it all happen? Willing to be a self-directed member of an agile and highly collaborative team, and organization? If you answered yes to any of these questions, we want to hear from you!

The Investment Solutions Group focuses on delivering state-of-the-art technological solutions to our stakeholders which includes traders, portfolio managers, and cross functional teams. We have a wide range of opportunities in systems designed for multi-asset trading, quantitative analysis, risk management, enterprise data warehousing, and micro-services for inter-application integrations. You will be exposed to a broad spectrum of investment management projects that involve front, mid, and back office stakeholders and make real, tangible impacts on HOOPP's performance.

As a software developer, you will contribute to transformative projects in finance and take part in shaping opportunities at the pace of global markets. At HOOPP, you'll have the chance to work on diverse teams and projects, reflecting our dynamic business and your evolving skills. You'll join a thriving community of technologists in a flat organization that values collaboration, creativity, and teamwork. UI Developers at HOOPP are not just problem-solvers; they are innovators, building advanced UI applications, designing intuitive user interfaces, and coding scalable solutions for investment trading, risk management, enterprise data, quantitative analysis, and microservice architecture. We seek developers who are versatile, design-focused, eager to tackle challenges, and driven to deliver seamless experiences across the full stack.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
DATA SCIENTIST - IT Data & AI
Work Hours: 9am-5pm (Flexible) (Onsite)
Location: Corporate Office, Mississauga, ON (2 days in-office and remote hybrid environment). Salary Range: $22.67-$36 (Work-Term Dependent)
Work-Term Duration: 4 months or 8 months (8 months preferred but not required)
Hiring Manager: Zohra Masudi Vacancies- 2

Overview

Purolator is looking for a highly analytical and professional Data Scientist Co-op student to support the delivery of advanced analytics, reporting, and insights focused on shipping patterns, revenue, volume and customer sentiment across various verticals, segments and locations, while supporting all lines of business. The ideal candidate will have experience working with large datasets and will contribute to the development and enhancement of analytics capabilities, including predictive modelling, Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, statistical analysis, data visualization and MLOps.

This role requires strong curiosity and proactive collaboration with both the Analytics team and business stakeholders. The successful candidate will demonstrate proficiency in gathering and synthesizing data from multiple sources and systems, and presenting clear, actionable insights. A core responsibility of this role is the ability to connect data points, uncover critical insights, and deliver a compelling narrative that influences data-driven decision-making across all areas of the business.

  • Proven ability to work with a team and contribute to a positive team environment.
  • Hands-on experience with cloud-based tools and technologies for data storage, processing and analytics is an asset

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Justice Technology Services (JTS) is a cluster within the Ontario government focused on modernizing the province's justice system through innovative IT solutions. JTS develops and implements systems for case management, digital evidence processing, and improving the delivery of legal services, with the goal of enhancing efficiency, accessibility, and fairness. By modernizing court processes and streamlining operations, JTS works to improve the overall experience for both the public and legal professionals in Ontario.

Purpose of Position
Assisting the Regional Systems Team in the tier 2 IT support of judicial and Court Services Division clients. Helping with project implementations/rollouts, reimaging of computers, deploying new hardware and maintaining asset inventories.

A bit about us:

The Justice Video Network (JVN) in Ontario is an innovative initiative that leverages video conferencing technology to make the justice system more accessible and efficient. It connects various courts, correctional facilities, and other legal stakeholders across Ontario, allowing hearings, trials, and meetings to take place remotely. This is especially helpful in rural or remote areas where physical access to courtrooms might be limited. The network is used for a wide range of legal matters, from bail hearings to witness testimony, making the entire legal process more efficient and less costly.

What makes supporting the JVN through a co-op placement so cool is that you're directly contributing to an important, real-world application of technology in the legal field. You'll gain valuable experience working with cutting-edge tools that improve the justice system's accessibility, ensuring people can participate in legal proceedings even if they can't physically attend court. You'd also be helping to optimize a system that makes legal processes smoother for everyone involved-court staff, legal professionals, and the public.
Additionally, working with the JVN offers insight into how technology and law intersect, and you'd have a chance to support a network that is essential in modernizing the justice system. It's a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in both tech and law, which can be a great advantage for future career opportunities, especially in the growing field of legal tech.

You'd be making a tangible difference in people's ability to access justice, and there's a sense of pride in knowing your work supports a system that impacts the daily lives of Ontarians. Plus, the opportunity to work with professionals across different sectors-tech, law enforcement, and legal practitioners-adds to the excitement and value of the experience.

Any consequences that ensue from having inappropriate documentation are the student's responsibility. You own your immigration status in a foreign country. (3) REQUIREMENTS FOR INTERNATIONAL WORK TERMS: Review mandatory and other requirements for students working outside Canada on our Work Abroad Requirements webpage (opens in a new window) thoroughly before you apply for this job.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
As a Junior User Experience Designer Co-op, you'll have the opportunity to contribute meaningfully to our projects while developing your skills and building a portfolio of impactful work. You'll assist in shaping the user experience for diverse digital products by engaging in every stage of the design process-from understanding user needs to delivering polished prototypes.
In this role, you'll work alongside experienced UX professionals, Product Managers, and cross-functional teams, gaining exposure to real-world challenges and learning how to navigate them with creativity and collaboration. You'll have the opportunity to contribute to projects that prioritize inclusivity, accessibility, and user-centered design, making a tangible impact on the lives of our users.
Your contributions will include assisting in user research to uncover pain points, analyzing user research data, creating wireframes and prototypes that bring ideas to life, and collaborating with stakeholders to refine solutions. This is a hands-on, immersive role designed to equip you with the skills, experience, and confidence needed to thrive in the field of UX.

Why Join Us?
  • A supportive environment that values creativity, collaboration, and professional growth.
  • Opportunities to work on projects with tangible impact.
  • A culture that embraces innovation and continuous learning.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
About Dematic
Dematic is a global engineering company that provides a comprehensive range of intelligent warehouse logistics and materials handling solutions. With a global knowledge network of more than 4,000 skilled logistics professionals, Dematic is able to provide customers with a unique perspective in world-class materials handling solution design. Our commitment to solution development, combined with engineering centers and manufacturing plants in North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific, ensures Dematic has the range and capability to provide reliable, flexible, cost-effective solutions globally. Our successful track record has led to the development and implementation of more than 5,000 integrated systems for a customer base that includes small, medium, and large companies doing business in a variety of market sectors. Dematic generates a global business volume of approximately $1.3 billion.

Job Description
The Global R&D Software Organization in Dematic creates high-performance software that helps some of the largest companies in the world manage and optimize their warehouse and distribution operations. In our Waterloo office we are building a world-class global software organization with leadership in data analytics, performance engineering, full facility emulation, test automation, and agile development. We have a fun, small startup environment within a large global company.

We offer a range of software engineering opportunities, from product development to software systems emulation. Our team is using the Unity3D game engine to simulate hardware components. You will participate in all aspects of the software development lifecycle, including hands-on design, programming, and validation.

You must have a passion for learning, taking on new challenges, and working in a team to build great software.

The Cluster Applications Branch is responsible for providing leadership in the planning, development, delivery and support of business application solutions. Through services such as consulting and collaboration with clients in their business planning, the branch provides the expertise to ensure that I&IT solutions align with program goals and commitments. The branch also provides application development expertise for implementing new business application solutions and provides the leadership and accountability for business solution delivery projects. Beyond initial development and deployment of new application solutions, the branch provides operational support and enhancements to the existing application portfolio. Support includes day to day operations, fixes, preventative maintenance and functional enhancements.

Are you a tech-savvy student that thrives in the technical and analytical aspects of server operating systems and configurations?

Apply to the GovTechON Co-Op Program today and allow us to be a part of your first step towards your prospective career path. GovTechON is home to professionals who work in partnership with ministries across the Government of Ontario to develop, deploy and maintain technology to deliver enhanced services and business outcomes for Ontarians.

Job Posting Information.Required Skills:
What we are looking for:

Knowledge:
Position requires:
1. Knowledge of industry standard systems development life cycles, methodologies (e.g., Waterfall, Iterative, Agile/Scrum and UPM, etc) and techniques (e.g., Service-Oriented Architecture, Software as a Service and other architecture and design patterns) to contribute to the analysis, design, development, testing and implementation of complex Ministry/HSC solutions.

2. Knowledge of a variety of industry standard systems analysis methods and techniques in order to:
• establish business, information, and system testing needs;
• review client business and information requirements and design and develop applications which satisfy these requirements;
• evaluate costs and benefits of various application options and recommend appropriate, cost effective solutions;
• analyze and create test data to support the systems testing strategy;
• assist clients in identifying information requirements and collecting data;
• assess and review client requirements in order to determine the possible integration with, or use of, an existing system;
• interview users regarding business, information, and system testing needs and documenting these needs to fit within established divisional standards

3. Knowledge of a variety of industry standard systems design methods and techniques in order to:
• translate functional design specifications into detailed coding specifications before beginning assigned programming and testing tasks;
• review system and software requirements documents in order to prepare detailed design documents which satisfy these requirements;
• participate in the development of complete system specifications;
• develop detailed programming specifications for moderately complex programs

4. Knowledge of various mainframe, mid-range, and personal computer systems technologies (including operating systems, networks, and applications development software) in order to:
• code and test business applications for deployment on any of the Ministry's environments;
• assist with the implementation of new and enhanced systems;
• perform setup and configuration of Ministry applications;
• train or arrange for the training of end users on Ministry applications.

5. Knowledge of a variety of industry standard programming languages, server-based technologies and development techniques for all phases of development in mainframe, n-tier/internet technologies (e.g. HTML, NET, JAVA platform, Cognos, Informatica, Websphere, DataPower, WebFOCUS, Remedy, COBOL, JCL, etc.) to:
• perform assigned programming and debugging for moderately complex business applications;
• provide recommendations to project manager as to the acceptance or rejection of system components;
• provide practical, technical input to innovative applications design and development;
• contribute to the resolution of complex technical problems;

6. Knowledge of various industry standard relational database management systems and query tools to examine test databases (e.g., DB2, Oracle) to ensure that the integrity of the production databases will be maintained after implementation of a new or modified application; monitor for problems to ensure ongoing availability of systems.

7. Knowledge of commonly used business software (e.g. word processing, spreadsheet, database management) in order to:
• write, edit, and maintain program, systems, user, and operational documentation for assigned portions of a system;
• document expected and actual test results for assigned portions of programming and/or testing activities;
• develop complete systems, user and operations documentation.

8. Knowledge of various industry standard testing methods, techniques and tools at various levels of testing (unit, integration, system, UAT, etc.) to:
• conduct system testing by executing online and batch test scripts, and manual online and batch jobs;
• perform system testing to ensure the accuracy and integrity of business applications;
• develop assigned portions of testing documentation including detailed test cases, automated test scripts, and comprehensive audit materials;
• identify and debug problems encountered with software usage;
• provide hardware, communications, applications, and network support including providing on site expertise to end users;
• track problems using an automated problem logging system and ensuring accuracy and completeness of problem documentation for follow-up or corrective action

9. Knowledge of client/server, and Internet/Intranet (e-services), cloud, and other emerging, state of the art technology in order to design, code, and test business applications in a client/server environment.

10. Knowledge of the clients' business in order to:
• collect and document information on business requirements;
• analyze information and system needs to ensure adherence with stated program area objectives;
• analyze system testing needs to ensure adequate testing of all systems prior to recommending promotion into production;
• participate in the development of recommendations on appropriate solutions.

11. Good knowledge of customer service techniques to contribute to the support of other team members for Priority 1 & 2 incident/problem resolution, education and information including knowledge of IT Infrastructure Library (ITIL), incident/problem resolution, technical change management processes, terms and definitions in order to provide systems analysis, support and manage change.

12. Knowledge of client business environment, including related program, HSC and government-wide legislation (e.g., FIPPA, AODA, PHIPA, etc) to define technical scope of work with HSC manager/leader.

Skills:
This position requires:
1. Analysis skills to determine the nature of issues or problems, including researching relevant materials and comparing and verifying information.
2. Ability to respond to the issues or problems by evaluating and comparing a number of existing alternatives and selecting the appropriate action.
3. Written and oral skills to convey, fully grasp and explain detailed information which may involve specialized information technology terminology; and to follow, present and discuss logically developed, complex arguments, ideas or issues.
4. Interpersonal skills to provide clarification and explanation to deal with problems or complaints and to assist with others' understanding of computer hardware and software.
5. Ability to work effectively in a team environment, sharing information and communicating with co-workers, management and clients.

  • Conduct unit testing, integration testing, and end-to-end testing of software components.
  • Collaborate with quality assurance teams to identify and address software defects.
  • Perform code reviews and provide constructive feedback to team members.
Version Control and Collaboration:
  • Utilize version control systems (e.g., Git) to manage and track code changes.

  • Participate in agile development methodologies, attend stand-ups, and provide status updates.
  • Communicate progress, challenges, and solutions to team members and supervisors.
Documentation:

  • Maintain up-to-date documentation of APIs, libraries, and configurations.
Collaboration and Communication:

  • Communicate effectively within the team and with stakeholders to gather requirements and provide updates.
  • Raise concerns and suggest improvements during team discussions.

Project Management:

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
At VCT Group we believe in the future of solar architecture and electrification. We help our customers meet and exceed their sustainability goals while realizing their investment goals. We have evolved significantly over the past 10 years and so has the landscape for renewables. We have built and continue to maintain the majority of our solar projects in collaboration with our customers. With 300 projects, more than 20 million kWh of energy generated per year (enough to power 2000 homes!) and over 3,000 tonnes of CO2 emissions reduced per year; we are entering a period of strong growth. Our latest endeavors push the limits to rethink underutilized space, such as custom designed solar carports, drive electrification with modern and future ready EV charging solutions and work closely with industry leading developers to build out the future of how we generate, use and store electricity. Our team is seeking candidates that think beyond historical boundaries and push for a bright, prosperous and energy efficient future.

VCT Group is seeking Software Engineering Co-op to assist in development of our groundbreaking renewable energy platform. Our platform technology will simplify monitoring and data analytics of systems within renewable energy organizations. Working with big data, artificial intelligence the database and subsequent platform will ensure system are running efficiently and producing maximum potential power. Our robust solutions capable of ingesting, processing, analyzing, and visualizing data from thousands of data points to simplify and optimize in the form of a CMMS. We started this platform in the summer term and were able to lay much of the groundwork for the platform including login pages, security information, and main landing pages. The next term of students will be taking the platform to the next level, adding features and core functionalities and infrastructure to contribute to a working platform.

Don't miss this unique opportunity to be apart of the Clean Energy Revolution!

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
The NRC/ Digital Technologies Research Center The National Research Council (NRC) is the Government of Canada's largest research organization supporting industrial innovation, the advancement of knowledge and technology development. It represents a powerful partnering option for anyone looking to push the boundaries of science and industry.
Your challenge As a student joining NRC, you will work on career-related projects in an engaging and intellectually stimulating environment. The ideal candidate will become an integral part of a multidisciplinary team of researchers specializing in computer vision and robotics perception. This team is at the forefront of developing cutting-edge technologies to enhance the autonomy of AI-powered systems. The project focuses on derisking space-based robotics by using computer graphics simulation tools to identify potential limitations and determine classes of computer vision algorithms suitable for some space-based autonomous operations. You will be tasked with implementing computer graphics visualization tools that accurately model space assets, planets, and the sun, including their positioning and movement. These tools will be pivotal in derisking larger projects.
Length of term Student work terms last for approximately sixteen weeks (four months) based on a schedule of 37.5 hours per week.
Who is eligible You are eligible for the NRC Co-op Program if you attend a Canadian university/college, are enrolled in a recognized co-op program, possess a minimum of a B average and are a Canadian citizen or a permanent resident of Canada. Alternatively, foreign national students who meet the eligibility requirements, are studying in a recognised and eligible Canadian educational institution and possess a valid Co-op Work Permit may also apply.
Condition of employment:
  • Security clearance at the reliability level
Application requirements Please include the following documents with your application:
  • A cover letter
  • A resume
  • University/college transcripts
Notes The NRC is committed to the principles of employment equity and to achieving a workforce that is representative of the Canadian population. We encourage candidates to self-identify if they are an aboriginal person, a member of a visible minority group, a person with a disability or a woman.

We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment processes and work environments. If you require an accommodation in order to participate in the hiring process, please inform us in advance to make your needs known. Information received relating to accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.

We thank all students for showing interest in working at NRC CRC; however, only selected candidates will be contacted.
NRC values
  • Integrity - Behaving at all times ethically, honestly and objectively; being impartial and transparent with our colleagues, collaborators, stakeholders, clients and the people of Canada; and exercising sound stewardship of our resources,
  • Excellence - Pursuing excellence in all that we do - in our research and innovation, in our collaborations, in execution of our programs, in our support to firms, and in our delivery of our common corporate services.
  • Respect - Valuing and respecting the knowledge, expertise, and diversity of our colleagues, our workplace, our collaborators, our stakeholders and our clients to have an impact on Canada and the world.
  • Creativity - Harnessing our imagination, passion for excellence, scientific exploration, technology and innovation to generate new knowledge, new technologies, new business processes, and new collaborations for a better NRC and a better world.

Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:
What You'll Be Doing
The System Integration Developer is responsible for helping to implement, configure, and/or support the integration mechanisms that streamline and automate internal information flows. The successful applicant is expected to review API documentation for systems involved in the information flow and develop integration solution. We are looking for individuals who are interested in developing their capabilities and working towards being a strong contributor to the EA team. The successful candidate will be willing and able to:
• Design and implement integration custom solution between different systems with correct data mapping, using available system triggers and APIs
• Write reusable, testable, and efficient code
• Document the solutions and code that you have created
• Implement application data storage (if needed) and integrating with other data storage solutions (databases, key-value stores, blob stores, etc.)
• Maintain communications with system users and resource owners to understand current processes and data
• Communicate changes in processes and instructions on how to run and maintain new integration solutions to various collaborators
• Help curate and maintain repositories of architecture information

Are you focused on growing your career in the area of Systems Integration and Software Development? Teranet is rapidly growing its Enterprise Architecture program and looking to find individual eager to strengthen their skills. The team is actively working on developing a solution to integrate number of tools and systems and to automate information flows between them. This role will allow you the ability to actively work with these systems and play a key role in designing and developing integration solutions. Also through this role, you will have many opportunities to learn and expand your skills related to many Enterprise Architecture aspects.

Who We Are
Teranet is Canada's leader in the delivery and transformation of statutory registry services with extensive expertise in land and commercial registries. It also provides insightful property intelligence and data solutions to thousands of customers in the real estate, financial services, government, utilities, and legal markets.
Recent Awards We're truly honored to have been recognized as one of Greater Toronto's Top Employers for nine consecutive years. This prestigious list highlights organizations that excel in creating exceptional workplaces and setting industry standards. To learn more about the Greater Toronto's Top Employer award, please click here!
Teranet has received numerous awards for our technology platforms, expertise and our successful partnerships with the Provinces of Ontario and Manitoba. Check out our awards & recognitions here.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Who We Are; What We Do; Where We're Going

Magnet Forensics is a global leader in the development of digital investigative software that acquires, analyzes, and shares evidence from computers, smartphones, tablets, and IoT-related devices. We are continually innovating so our customers can deploy advanced and effective tools to protect their companies, communities, and countries.

Serving over 4,000 customers in over 100 countries, our solutions are playing a crucial role in modernizing digital investigations, helping investigators fight crime, protect assets, and guard national security.

With employees based around the world, Magnet Forensics has been expanding our global presence with offices in Waterloo and Ottawa, Canada; Atlanta, GA, Herndon, VA, Westminster, CO; Gothenburg, Sweden and Singapore. As a part of Magnet Forensics, you can expect to make a difference in the world, no matter what role you play. You'll be supported through learning and development, not to mention an incredible team with unbelievable talent and integrity.

If you think you would be the right person to join our team working towards this goal, we would love to hear from you!
Job Posting Information.Required Skills:
What We Are Looking For
We hire passionate people who enjoy technical challenges. We love problem solvers who want to keep learning, individually and as part of the team. We want people who collaborate and help others. We foster a team environment where everyone is comfortable sharing their ideas, because we understand that with diversity of thought, we will build the best products.

We're looking for someone who checks off most, but not all, of the boxes. It's more important to us to find a candidate who can display indicators of success through skills they have developed and experience they have been a part of, than to find folks who have "been there, done that". We want to be a part of your development journey, and we'll learn as much from you as you learn from us.

There are a couple must haves, but we will keep that list short:
  • You are a student working towards a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering or a related discipline
  • You're strong at object-oriented programming (Languages: Java/JavaScript, C#, C++, Python)
  • You're familiar with at least some of: Build systems, automated test execution, AWS/Azure/GCP, shell scripting, Infrastructure as Code
  • You are accountable and take ownership of your projects
  • You like working in a collaborative environment with smart, funny and interesting people

The Most Important Thing

We're looking for candidates that can provide examples of how they have demonstrated Magnet CODE in their previous experiences:
CARE - We care about each other and our mission to make a difference in the world.
OWN - We are accountable for our results - while never forgetting to act with integrity, empathy, and respect.
DEDICATE - We put our heart and soul into meeting the needs of our customers and helping them serve the people they protect.
EVOLVE - We are constantly innovating and exploring new ways to work together to make an impact with our work.

Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:
Are you a tech-savvy student that thrives in the technical and analytical aspects of server operating systems and configurations? If your answer is yes, apply to the GovTechON Co-Op Program today and allow us to be a part of your first step towards your prospective career path.

GovTechON is home to professionals who work in partnership with ministries across the Government of Ontario to develop, deploy and maintain technology to deliver enhanced services and business outcomes for Ontarians.

In this role you will:
  • Ensure digital applications are fully tested and conform to Accessibility standards with the common goal of ensuring frictionless implementation of technology solution.
  • Contribute as an active team member to Agile projects. Be accountable for understanding user story content, determining test approaches, creating tasks, and providing daily progress updates to team members.
  • Work closely with business analyst, project manager, developers, and designers to suggest modifications or improvements to enhance the product's accessibility. Ensure accessibility considerations are integrated into the development process. update software code to ensure they meet accessibility standards and business needs.
  • Design, write, execute, and validate test cases, document results, create any required defects, and assign them to the development team for review. Test cases may be executed on a variety of technologies including desktop, mobile etc.
  • Identify bugs and log in Azure Devops tool accordingly. Provide support in end user testing and ensure technology is of good quality and bug free before launching in production.
  • Research new tools, techniques, and guidelines to enhance testing skills and keep pace with evolving accessibility standards.
  • Participate in conducting training sessions or workshops to educate developers, designers, and other stakeholders on the developed solution. Assist in creating training documentation as needed.
  • Use technologies such as Microsoft power pages, dynamics 365, word press, Postman tool for testing APIs, Azure Devops for Agile project delivery.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Radar is geolocation infrastructure for every product and service. The Radar platform handles 1 Billion API calls per day. Companies like Vercel, Panera, and T-Mobile use Radar's geofencing SDKs and maps APIs to power location-based experiences across hundreds of millions of devices worldwide.

This role is in our NYC HQ.

We're looking for Full-stack, Backend, and Mobile Engineers to build customer-facing infrastructure. Radar co-ops can work on the frontend, backend, iOS/Android, and data engineering. Keep in mind, you don't need to be an expert in all of these (and you don't have to work on all of these stacks) but it definitely helps to have experience with in 1-2 areas.
This mode of work would be ideal for an engineer that's interested in acquiring new skills. We find it to be more efficient and interesting than being siloed in 1-2 stacks. We also have a collaborative engineering culture that allows you to learn new and complex things from your team and vice versa. You'll face exciting data and scaling challenges.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills:
• Some engineering experience
  • Understanding in 1-2 of the following areas: frontend, backend, iOS/Android, data engineering
  • Perseverance in the face of challenges

For specific information on the USA visa process that affects co-op employment, refer to our USA Work Permit/J-1 Visa webpage.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Join our team
Voiceflow is on a mission to democratize conversational AI by making conversation design easy, collaborative, and accessible to anyone (no matter their technical background).

Design, prototype, and launch voice and chatbots - with little to no code

We're building the next generation of design tools. Conversations are part of everyday interactions and an integral part of conversation design interfaces - come help shape the future of conversation design and conversational AI with us. If you believe that humans will talk to computers more, then it's worth betting on Voiceflow.
We are currently a series A company backed by Felicis, Craft, True, Amazon, Google & CEOs of Webflow, Invision, Producthunt, and more. We are a small remote team of around 45 team members around the world, composed of dedicated and talented individuals with a core focus on engineering and product.

About the role
At Voiceflow, we are proud of our highly responsive and uniform user experience that has been carefully hand-crafted and tested in-depth. To ensure the quality of that experience we have a dedicated team of design engineers who implement each component used in our frontend applications.
As a Frontend Component Library Engineer, you will take part in the development and maintenance of our component library. In this position you will work closely with key stakeholders from the Product and Design teams to understand UI/UX needs, their design philosophies, and engineering constraints.

Job Posting Information.Compensation and Benefits:
What's in it for you
  • Hands-on experience in automation and API testing in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
  • Mentorship from industry professionals and exposure to best practices in QA automation.
  • Opportunities to work with cutting-edge tools and technologies in QA and software development.
  • The chance to make a direct impact on the quality of a highly visible, customer-facing platform.
  • Compensation ranges from CAD $23-$27/hour
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:
What you'll do
Test Automation:
  • Design, develop, and maintain automated test scripts for UI and API testing using industry-standard tools and frameworks (e.g., Cypress, Playwright, Postman, RestAssured).
  • Integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines to enable efficient regression testing.
  • Identify areas of the platform that require enhanced automation coverage and address gaps proactively.
API Testing:
  • Develop and execute API test cases, validating RESTful APIs for functionality, performance, and security.
  • Implement automated API testing strategies and tools to ensure end-to-end API reliability.
  • Collaborate with backend engineers to address API-related bugs and enhancements.
Manual and Exploratory Testing:
  • Conduct manual testing where necessary, particularly for complex workflows, edge cases, and exploratory scenarios.
  • Document and track defects clearly and collaborate with the development team for timely resolutions.
  • Execute stress tests and identify production risks before feature rollouts.
Documentation and Reporting:
  • Create and maintain detailed test cases, focusing on automation scalability and high-priority user scenarios.
  • Document and communicate test results, ensuring visibility of automated test coverage and reliability metrics.
  • Contribute to the creation of a testing knowledge base for continuous improvement.
Collaboration and Innovation:
  • Partner with software engineers, designers, and product teams to integrate testing into the development lifecycle seamlessly.
  • Participate actively in team meetings, retrospectives, and discussions to propose innovative testing solutions.
Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
About the role
We are seeking a QA Automation Intern with strong experience in test automation and API testing to elevate our testing practices and maintain a high standard of quality across our platform. Reporting to the Senior Software Engineer in Test, you will work closely with engineers, product managers and designers to support seamless feature releases and robust testing processes. You will have the opportunity to leverage your skills in automation and API testing to enhance our testing coverage, identify and resolve bugs, and contribute to the evolution of our QA practices.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills:
What you'll bring
  • A degree (completed or in progress) in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related technical field.
  • Proven experience with automated testing frameworks such as Cypress, Playwright, or Selenium.
  • Hands-on experience with API testing tools like Postman, RestAssured, or similar.
  • Strong knowledge of software testing principles, methodologies, and best practices.
  • Familiarity with CI/CD processes and integrating automated tests into pipelines.
  • Excellent analytical skills and a proactive attitude toward solving complex challenges.
  • Outstanding communication and collaboration skills to work effectively in a team environment.
Nice to haves
  • Experience with performance testing tools (e.g., JMeter, k6).
  • Familiarity with containerization tools like Docker.
  • Proficiency in programming languages like JavaScript, TypeScript, or Python.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Join Wisedocs as a Machine Learning Engineer, where you'll play an important part in building v2 of our medical document analysis platform. This role is ideal for someone who wants to build models end to end, from data processing, to paper reading to iterating once in production. You'll be building models with real-time inference in mind, ML Ops best practices, and a combination of Multi Modal LLM and encoder-based work.

What We Have
We currently have two types of ML systems running in production, an entity classification system and a RAG summarization system. Our entity classification has been in production for 4 years and currently processes data asynchronously with a combination of models.

What You'll Do
  • Drive the update and re-architecture of our ML systems to have higher throughput, reliability and observability
  • Improve search and summarization techniques across multiple modalities
  • Collaborate with other senior engineers to integrate the ML system into the broader Wisedocs platform.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills:
• Minimum of 2 internships in software development, with a strong focus on Python programming.
  • Ability to think through problems end to end, including data, infrastructure, research, monitoring and inference considerations
  • A desire to develop high-quality, maintainable code.
  • Prior experience with transfer learning and finetuning
  • Excellent problem-solving skills in an independent and team setting
  • Are enthusiastic about working in a fast-paced, innovative environment, contributing to a team that aims to make a significant impact in the medical and insurance tech space.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
The Financial Services Regulatory Authority of Ontario (FSRA) is a dynamic, innovative, independent and self-funded regulator of financial services and pensions. The organization promotes strong financial services and pension sectors while protecting the public interest. FSRA has responsibility for regulating property and casualty insurance (including auto insurance rates); life and health insurance; Credit Unions and Caisses Populaires; loan and trust companies; mortgage brokers; health service providers (related to auto insurance); and pension plans. We are building an agile, forward-thinking and collaborative culture, and FSRA is committed to encouraging innovation and competition, and promoting market integrity and stability. This is an exciting opportunity to help shape the regulator of the future.

PURPOSE OF POSITION
Accountable for assisting the Technical Lead and other team member in bug fix, application enhancement, building new application, testing and user support

REPORTS TO Senior Manager, Applications

Test execution:

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
The Junior Analyst Tester role at FNZ is involved in business and functional solution design, technical analysis of FNZ's platform capabilities, business processes analysis and end to end testing (including supporting client UAT).

Within this role, you will get the opportunity to work both independently and within a client aligned team to examine existing IT systems and business models, analyze requirements (both business and technical) and to translate these into user stories and core functionality documentation. These activities will include the management of stakeholders (internal and external) to ensure that solution designs meet client requirements. The analyst also be required to work closely with IT developers to provide oversight and clarity on the development solution.

You will gain a broad knowledge of FNZ platform capabilities and a deep understanding of assigned functional areas of the FNZ platform.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Rodan Energy is a leading North American provider of solutions that help our customers meet their goal of having a reliable, sustainable supply of power. Together, we are making sustainable, attainable!

Join Rodan to be part of a growing and innovative industry. Rodan was recognized as one of Canada's Top Small & Medium Employers for three years in a row! This is a terrific place to learn and grow in your career and be part of a positive work environment. We offer rewarding careers and foster a collaborative culture where employees can produce their best work and reach their full potential.

We have an exciting opportunity available for a Software Developer Co-op Student to help your career development in the industry.

As a Software Developer Co-op Student, you will participate in the design, implementation, and maintenance of a suite of SaaS software tools to visualize energy market information and help minimize our customer's energy spending. Reporting to the Senior Software Developer, you will work with other development team members to deliver best-in-class solutions. To be successful in this position, you should be a person with strong technical knowledge who is always learning and discovering opportunities in a dynamic, innovative, and ever-changing energy industry!

Rodan fosters a culture that promotes health and wellness and encourages work-life balance. You will be required to work at our Corporate HQ in Mississauga a minimum of 4 days per week to attend and participate in workshops, projects, or team meetings.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
In this role you will assist with the creation of LiftWerx's next generation training program. You will drive LiftWerx's goal of developing better, more engaging training methods for new wind turbine technicians. Your primary responsibilities will include Training module application development (designing, coding, debugging, quality assurance and documenting) of training modules, which are representative of real-life tasks and work processes.

Typical projects for this role will first involve reading and understanding work procedures and creating a storyboard for how to convey the training in a module. Next steps will include converting and optimizing existing procedures, manuals documentation into the modules.

On a voluntary and occasional basis, the student will have the opportunity for field work, where they will learn how up-tower cranes are assembled and operated within wind turbines.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Website Development Coordinator / Teaching Assistant
Are you passionate about education? Be part of a team that utilizes technology to transform the way students learn a new language or discover their passion for STEAM. There is no better place to make an impact - join U+ today!

About U+ Education:
U+ Education is a global, innovation-driven educational technology company dedicated to the long-term success of our students. We connect highly qualified Canadian teachers with students worldwide for interactive immersion learning in English, French, Spanish, Mandarin, Cantonese, Korean, and Japanese. Beyond language programs, U+ Education has expanded its offerings to include STEAM programs, which encompass coding and various camp programs to cater to a broad spectrum of students. With this expansion, we are eager to collaborate with talents from various disciplines to foster growth and development within the U+ community.

About this opportunity:
We are seeking a skilled and passionate co-op student to join us as a Website Development Coordinator and Teaching Assistant. In this role, you will be coordinating resources to assemble and edit materials on our websites (e.g. events, graphics) to enhance appeal and branding. You will also be expanding U+'s education curriculum and delivering our programs.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills:
A great candidate for this position will possess the following:
  • Dedication and passion toward all-round language, STEAM and sports education; web design; and content management.
  • Working knowledge and prior experience working with website frameworks (e.g. Wix and WordPress) and e-commerce platforms (e.g. Shopify).
  • General understanding of programming languages like HTML & CSS.
  • Proficiency in using Google Workspace and Canva.
  • Creative and innovative thinking and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills and attention to detail.
  • Excellent organizational skills and ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to work 35 to 40-hour work weeks, including evenings and weekends based on your assigned shift.
  • Ability to commute to locations (e.g., schools and community centers) across York Region to deliver programs and camps. (Locations are accessible via public transit, but transit transfers may be necessary.)
  • A valid Standard First Aid with CPR-C certification and a satisfactory Vulnerable Sector Check is required from successful candidates. These can be obtained after co-op employment is secured.
Assets:
  • Experience in graphic design and marketing.
  • Experience in teaching and/or working with children and adolescents.
  • Fluency in more than one language (encompassing reading, writing, speaking, and listening abilities).
  • Access to a car and a valid G2/G Ontario driver's license.

You will work with the team to design and build software solutions that solve client problems with well-crafted and maintainable code, as well as comprehensive automated testing. In return, you can expect latitude in how you choose to work and the approaches you take while receiving direct support, guidance, and coaching from Bit Complete's engineers and partners.

You'll be expected to:
  • Contribute to project components from start to finish
  • Build, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software
  • Manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables
  • Tackle challenging technical issues
  • Collaborate closely with teammates and clients
Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
About Us
Bit Complete is a remote consulting bootstrapped start-up founded and led by engineers. We thrive on delivering meaningful value to clients while fostering a healthy and sustainable culture. Our diverse team includes ex-Googlers, seasoned developers, and Waterloo grads across Canada and Brazil.

We prioritize building strong relationships with fledgling startups and major companies, such as Highnote and OpenSea, by delivering impactful code and going beyond client requests.

Find out more at bitcomplete.io

Why Join Us
If you're eager to enhance your software development skills in a supportive environment, we want you! As a part of our team, you'll have the chance to take ownership of significant projects, from concept to production, with close mentorship from a small, experienced team.

What We Offer
You will have the opportunity to take ownership of a project and see it through to production, with close mentorship from a small team.

We offer:
  • Ownership of meaningful projects with mentorship from senior engineers
  • Experience in a fast-paced start-up, accelerating your practical skills
  • While we are a fully remote team, we offer a co-working space in Toronto for team members who enjoy an in-person working experience. In-office work is completely optional and will not be required.
  • Opportunity for quick, substantial impact
  • Collaborative and fun small company environment
  • Exposure to various technologies in real products and live environments
This job requires you to work remotely from CANADA.

Candidates should have:
  • Some previous experience coding a JavaScript React web application, or similar (Vue, Angular, etc.), with a solid understanding of React fundamentals.
  • Strong attention to detail and a keen interest in, or experience with, crafting clean and maintainable template markup and CSS.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
We also consider the following as helpful assets:
  • Experience or familiarity with writing TypeScript.
  • Coding, testing, and deploying internet applications or similar projects.
  • Proficiency in software debugging, particularly for client-side JavaScript/TypeScript.
  • Experience calling into GraphQL APIs to fetch data.
  • Background in collaborative engineering teams, with a track record of owning software components end to end.

Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:
WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING
Working with a development team at the Ottawa Research and Development facility, and reporting to a senior developer, the successful candidate will experience first-hand the highs and lows of real software development while working with top-level developers and team leaders. Specifically, you'll assist the Hyperconverged Solutions (HCS) Product Team with Software Development tasks, including UI and/or Embedded systems programming. A variety of different languages and technologies are used, providing opportunities for interested candidates with a variety of different interests and backgrounds.
Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
WHERE YOU'LL BE WORKING
Ross Video is a world leader in High Definition Video Production Equipment, designed and manufactured in Canada and sold world-wide. Our products are used by a who's who of the global entertainment industry, including top broadcast networks like NBC, ABC, CBS and Fox in the USA; Rogers, CTV and the CBC in Canada and others around the world from Fiji to Finland and everywhere in between. We are # 1 in providing behind the scenes HD production gear used in Sports Stadiums including places where the Atlanta Falcons, NY Mets, LA Lakers, Pittsburgh Penguins and Buffalo Bills play. Our equipment was used extensively at the Vancouver 2010 and other Olympic games. Our systems are used by top acts including Springsteen, Blink 182, The Red Hot Chili Peppers and the Police to name a few. Top webcasters like Revision 3 and MLB.com use Ross. Our equipment is even used on the International Space Station. Join Ross and you will have a chance to work on advanced technology used in a wide variety of very cool ways by our clients.

This position is located at our office on Auriga Drive in Nepean however most teams have adopted a hybrid-work model. Our pay rates range from $23 - $34 per hour, based on experience.

WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR?
If this sounds like you - or who you want to be - then include a few words with your application about who you are and what you want out of this position at Ross Video. Many of our current team members started their career as a co-op at Ross. What are you waiting for? We want to hear from you.

EQUITY, DIVERSITY & INCLUSION
At Ross, we embrace diversity, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work. We are committed to building a team that includes a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Inclusivity drives innovation and creativity, and that's something we're passionate about at Ross! We believe everyone should be able to enjoy a rewarding career at Ross, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, veteran status, physical or mental disability. If a disability means that you need any additional support during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills:
WHAT YOU KNOW
  • Currently enrolled in Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Computer Science at the Intermediate level
  • Programming experience, ideally in one or more of the following languages C & C++
  • Other desirable skills or areas of interest, considered a plus:
    • Yocto Project: BitBake, OpenEmbedded, and the Yocto build system.
    • Embedded Linux Basics - Uboot, Linux kernel, cross-compiling, boot flow.
    • Unix/Linux command line tools.
    • Python scripting.
    • Knowledge of Java, GO and other scripting languages.
    • Git
    • Docker
WHO YOU ARE
  • You enjoy new technical challenges and are excited at the prospect of writing code for actual, shipping products. Tasks can range from creating custom-built software applications helping to tweak existing practices and designs. Big or small, you're up for the job.
  • You are a self-starter. You're happy to take the reins and take initiative. When you finish something, you're already looking for the next challenge.
  • You like people. Knowledge is all around you, and you know that finding and talking to the right people is the way to get things done.
  • You recognize that communication skills are as important as technical skills.
  • You love learning new stuff. You know how to ask questions - and how to listen to answers. You absorb knowledge like a sponge. You're happy to dig through code, track down obscure issues, and solve problems other people haven't.

Passionate about React? So are we. Dive into the world of large-scale React applications and discover how top-tier companies push the boundaries of what's possible with our component-based architecture. Master building reusable UI components.

Tackle immense challenges. Engage with intricate engineering problems, taking full ownership of solutions that impact millions of shoppers daily.

Design Interfaces. We believe that people who truly care about creating great software should design it themselves. You will design your own software instead of being at the mercy of Figma.

Accelerate your impact. Collaborate across teams to deliver projects at lightning speed, embracing the fast-paced nature of React development. Code with the founding team. Our founders are always boots on the ground.
Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
FUEGO.io is building the world's most customizable and extensible mobile commerce platform, powering iconic brands like True Classic, Dossier, Kitsch, DRMTLGY, Cuts Clothing, Rainbow Shops, and more. Our platform leverages the latest advances in generative AI to turn Shopify stores into fully native and customizable mobile apps packed with social commerce features in minutes!

Over 70% of all e-commerce transactions now happen on mobile devices, and having a mobile app allows brands to form deeper connections with their customers while improving retention and driving higher conversion rates.

We are seeking a talented Full Stack Developer with expertise in React, NodeJS, and React Native to collaborate closely with our founders. Your role will involve enhancing, maintaining, and expanding the capabilities of our mobile e-commerce platform, which serves millions of shoppers worldwide. We are looking for someone who is curious, loves working at the intersection of design and engineering, and enthusiastic about creating flawless user interfaces using React.

Working at FUEGO.io will give you the opportunity to shape how millions of people shop around the world everyday.

  • Skilled in managing the full lifecycle of web applications, including build process automation, deploying SPAs to the cloud, implementing server-side rendering, and optimizing caching strategies
  • Adept at creating and improving component libraries.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Adentro (www.adentro.com) is turning real-world data into the marketing fuel businesses need. Now more than ever, brick-and-mortar businesses are looking for solutions that will drive their growth in a post-pandemic world. Through its North American network of over 7000 sensor locations, Adentro collects a billion points of data per-day, 24/7/365. That data is at the core of our real-time analytics and warehousing system, where we generate the information that drives online marketing programs through platforms including Facebook and Instagram. Millions of users interact with our products on a regular basis.

If you are interested in mobile devices and advanced Wi-Fi technologies, high performance data analytics and warehousing, dashboard presentation and reporting, or Amazon Web Services and data security, we have a spot for you on our team.

Adentro is a San Francisco-based company backed by the biggest names in Silicon Valley. Our remote first technical teams are located throughout southwestern Ontario, primarily in Waterloo Region. We offer a flexible work environment and a team that has years of involvement with the University of Waterloo co-op program.

This position is available as a remote position, within Canada (except QC) or the US, with the requirement for working core eastern time zone hours.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills: We're looking for smart people who get stuff done. It means you can work independently, but you know when to get help from your mentor. It means you aren't afraid of unsolved problems, large code bases, and a complex web of microservices, because you'll be working the same way we do everyday.

Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:
As a member of our Security and DevOps team a successful candidate will be responsible for several independent projects focusing on various aspects of application security and cloud infrastructure including:

  • Improving the security of our applications applications through identifying and correcting security vulnerabilities with the assistance of security vulnerability detection software

  • Development of Monitoring, Alerting and Automation solutions for Operational and Security infrastructure

  • Ensuring that our OS images, Docker containers, and Application software are in compliance with our security policies and goals

  • Integration of SSO/SAML Authentication mechanisms into our web application

Improvements to our network infrastructure, email and DNS security posture

You'll have the opportunity to make a significant contribution to the success of our security and operations programs.

Technologies you'll use

Join us and learn how a modern SaaS company operates and manages security infrastructure. Our technology stack includes Python/Django/Flask, Go, and Scala/Java for our microservices backend, MongoDB, PostgreSQL and Cassandra for the data tier. Kafka for our data event pipeline. Snowflake and Mode for data warehousing, and AWS (S3, ECS, ALB, EC2, Route53, KMS) and Terraform for infrastructure.

Customer Support:
  • Respond in a timely manner to Live Chat messages and emails from students, professors, and school administrators:

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Kritik is an early-stage ed-tech startup that focuses on helping students develop their critical and creative thinking abilities, communication, and leadership skills in modern higher education. Our system has emerged from a decade of research and experience working with the teaching faculties in dozens of universities across North America. Our company is co-founded by the co-CEO and CAO of Top Hat, and together, our team strives to make learning engaging, effective, and efficient for everyone.

We are looking for highly motivated, energetic self-starters with excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to produce high-quality work in a fast-paced environment. This job is great for anyone who wants to get involved with the customer experience side of a business, without being in sales. You will be working with and reporting directly to our amazing Director of Customer Success, and we will also happily find opportunities for you to collaborate with other teams depending on your interests and professional development goals!

At Kritik, we value having a flat, collaborative, and creative work environment. We want to ensure all team members are healthy physically and mentally. We want employees to approach work feeling passionate about our vision and mission. Kritik encourages a fun environment with a lot of room for growth and support. We value innovative thinking and encourage our team to bring new ideas and fresh feedback to the table - that might look like providing constructive feedback, problem-solving, and having integrity with the work you provide.

Please note that for this job, 8-month co-ops are strongly preferred.

Job Posting Information.Compensation and Benefits:
$16.50-$55 per hour based on candidates experience

Why join us?
Competitive Compensation: We offer a paid co-op position, with potential for a full-time role down the line. For exceptional candidates, we would be open to paying the top end of the guided ranges.
Flexible & Hybrid Work: Blend remote flexibility with onsite collaboration. Plus, join quarterly meetups in inspiring cities-our next one is in Lisbon!
Exceptional Team & Technology: Collaborate with a world-class group of engineers and researchers working on state-of-the-art search, retrieval, and AI.
Hands-On Learning & Mentorship: Grow your skills under the guidance of experienced professionals, taking on real ownership of projects.
Impact & Growth: Shape the trajectory of a rapidly growing startup, solving hard problems in AI and seeing the tangible results of your work.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:
Key Responsibilities
  • Design and fine-tune embedding models.
  • Build advanced vector-based data representations.
  • Innovate with unsupervised learning.
  • Develop retrieval systems capable of handling billions of vectors.
  • Solve complex challenges in entity resolution and scale systems globally with MLOps.
Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
About Us
At Thema, we're pioneering how the world understands companies, markets, and industries with foundational AI research at web scale.
We regularly process hundreds of TB of data and develop novel embedding methods to crack the problem of company similarity and track market evolution. Backed by the world's best investors, the UK government, and working in partnership with Cambridge University and the world's leading companies, we're making breakthroughs that push the boundaries of AI.

What the Job Involves
As a Co-op ML Research Engineer, you'll work at the intersection of machine learning, large-scale data processing, and systems design. We're a small team of exceptional engineers and researchers tackling web-scale problems no one else is approaching. If you're an undergrad who's excited about pushing AI boundaries, we'd love to have you on board.

Example Projects
  • Advanced Embeddings: Develop vector representations of complex data to improve search and similarity.
  • Retrieval Systems: Enhance search pipelines using vector search, text search, re-ranking, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG).
  • Scalable LLM Pipelines: Design, implement, and optimize LLM pipelines and infrastructure at scale.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills:
Preferred Qualifications
Academic Background: Enrolled in a Bachelor's program (e.g., Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics) at the University of Waterloo Co-op or equivalent.
Prior Co-op Experience: Have already completed at least one work placement.
ML Fundamentals: Coursework or projects in machine learning, deep learning, or data science.
Hands-On Coding: Proficiency in Python for data processing and ML; exposure to PyTorch or TensorFlow is a plus.
Vector-Based Similarity: Familiarity with embedding methods or vector search (e.g., FAISS, HNSW).
Data Exploration & Prototyping: Comfortable cleaning data, feature engineering, and iterating quickly to test new ideas.
Open-Source Mindset: We value contributors who've demonstrated passion and skill through open-source projects.

Relevant technologies and tools
  • Frameworks: FastAPI, PyTorch, TensorFlow, HuggingFace.
  • Databases: PostgreSQL (including PGVector), ElasticSearch, OpenSearch.
  • Vector Databases: Weaviate, Pinecone, Milvus.
  • Search and Similarity: Faiss, HNSW, BM25.
  • Deployment and Optimization: Docker, Kubeflow.
  • Data Pipelines and Processing: Dask, Ray, Airflow, Prefect.
(No need to know them all-strong fundamentals and a desire to learn matter most.)
