Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:
About You:
You're a passionate software developer who loves turning ideas into reality. You thrive on creating innovative software solutions and enjoy collaborating with fellow developers, cross-functional teams, and leadership to build something meaningful. You're excited to learn, grow, and make an impact!

What You'll Do and How You'll Make an Impact:
  • Collaborate and Innovate: Work closely with Lim Geomatics leadership and a talented team to understand product requirements, contributing your ideas to shape software that matters.
  • Build Amazing Software: Develop software programs that are not only robust and maintainable but also efficient and elegant, making a tangible difference in the lives of our customers.
  • Full Development Cycle: Dive into developing, testing, and deploying software releases, ensuring that our products are delivered on schedule with top-notch quality.
  • Drive Growth: Play a key role in Lim Geomatics' growth by building applications and solutions that directly solve customer challenges and create new opportunities.
Why Join Us?
  • Real-World Experience: Gain hands-on experience in a leading geospatial software company, working on projects that have a real impact.
  • Mentorship & Growth: Learn from experienced professionals who are eager to help you grow and develop your skills.
  • Collaborative Environment: Be part of a team that values creativity, innovation, and collaboration.
  • Opportunity to Make an Impact: Your work here will not just be another line of code - it will help solve real challenges and shape the future of the industry.
Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Join Lim Geomatics, a global leader in geospatial software solutions, and gain hands-on experience in developing industry-transforming products for the forestry and natural resources sector.

As a Software Developer Co-op, you'll work with modern programming languages like Dart, Java, C#, Python, and TypeScript, while applying testing, debugging, and Agile development principles. If you have an interest in embedded systems, this is a great opportunity to learn.

We're looking for a current student who is eager to apply their skills in a real-world setting. This role requires in-person collaboration at our Ottawa office for meetings and access to specialized hardware.

Take your development skills to the next level while contributing to innovative geospatial solutions!
Job Posting Information.Required Skills:
What We're Looking For:
  • Current Student: You're currently enrolled in a university, college, or graduate program and eager to apply your skills in a real-world setting.
  • Programming Skills: Comfortable with high-level languages like Dart, Java, C#, or Python, TypeScript and eager to expand your expertise.
  • Testing & Debugging: Experience with debugging, unit testing, and integration testing - you believe in building software that's rock solid.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
LiftWerx is a specialized wind energy contractor, offering creative and innovative lifting solutions to perform repairs on wind turbines. Based in North America, LiftWerx provides turnkey services for major corrective repairs and major component replacements using up-tower crane technology. As a young company, we are always looking for opportunities to find driven, talented, and ambitious professionals who can contribute to the growth, optimization, and improvement of our business.

In this role, you will support LiftWerx's business development efforts by supporting and continuing development of our in-house written project management system. You will work to create new functionalities, improve existing functionalities, and support users of the system. The features of the system you will work on include project and asset scheduling, project and asset tracking, and creating tools that produce various reports and metrics from data received from various LiftWerx departments and teams spanning all of North America.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
ABOUT ONEX:
Onex is an investor and asset manager that invests capital on behalf of Onex shareholders and clients across the globe. Formed in 1984, we have a long track record of creating value for our clients and shareholders. Onex' two primary businesses are Private Equity and Credit. In Private Equity, we raise funds from third-party investors, or limited partners, and invest them, along with Onex' own investing capital, through the funds of our private equity platforms, Onex Partners and ONCAP. Similarly, in Credit, we raise and invest capital across several private credit, public credit and public equity strategies. Our investors include a broad range of global clients, including public and private pension plans, sovereign wealth funds, insurance companies, family offices and high net-worth individuals. In total, Onex has $50.9 billion in assets under management, of which $8.4 billion is Onex' own investing capital. With offices in Toronto, New York, New Jersey, Boston and London, Onex and its experienced management teams are collectively the largest investors across Onex' platforms.

THE OPPORTUNITY:
We are looking for a motivated and enthusiastic DBA Intern/Co-op. This individual will support our ONCAP investment professionals and their respective portfolio companies. This internship offers a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in database administration.

This opening may be of interest to students in
  • Computer science
  • Software architecture
  • Engineering
  • Business, Management and accounting
We are looking to recruit for a supplemental role in our IT department. This role is to support the existing staff. Below is brief description of the role.

Company Description
We are a North American Home Inspection Franchising business based in Toronto. We have over 550 locations and 1000 inspectors in Canada and US. You can find more information at www.pillartopost.com

Role Description
We have converted all our existing IT systems and applications to Salesforce.com. We are continuing to work on development of the software, and require a driven individual to support in our software development life cycle.

This individual will drive, coordinate, and manage specific items packaged as part of our release versions. You will engage directly with Salesforce and iOS developers, key stakeholders, and observe the full end-to-end software development life cycle of an enterprise level platform.

You will observe the defining and writing of business requirements; work on software quality assurance functional testing; engage with enterprise level software deployments; improve on manual testing scripts for regression testing of the system using blackbox testing methods; build on project to transition our manual testing to automated testing using the Selenium platform.

Pienso offers the opportunity to work with many exciting new technologies. Your time at Pienso will be spent iterating on the following goals:

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Pienso is a low-code / no-code interactive deep learning platform that allows collaboration between data science teams and subject matter experts within their own enterprise. Pienso is a deep tech company. We work on building large language models & machine learning systems.

Our company's goal is to democratize access to machine learning and make the results easily accessible to people with no prior background in advanced statistics or natural language processing. Our motto is human perspective + machine > just the machine.

Who We Are:

Pienso is an MIT spinoff based in Arlington, Virginia, Brooklyn, New York and Raleigh-Durham, North Carolina. Pienso is now a remote-first workforce. Our team is composed of machine learning hackers, full-stack engineers, and user-experience doyens. We value epic engineering, creativity, a high empathy work environment and in work-life balance.

Who You Are:

You're a passionate data centric software engineer who has experience working directly with product owners to deliver on both architectural & feature roadmaps. You are passionate to learn, eager to assume ownership of features and easy to collaborate with. You have a love for both user-centric design and highly performant large data systems. You work hand in hand with deep learning and DevOps engineers to build state-of-the-art interactive AI experiences. You're comfortable working in an un-siloed company and interacting with non-technical stakeholders.

Additional Information:

Pienso is proud to be an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer and encourages all applicants regardless of race, sex, gender identity, age, disability, religion, national origin, veteran status or sexual orientation. We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion.

  • Comfortable working at a venture-backed startup

We believe in the remote-first approach. We occasionally meet up or on a need basis to work together as a team. We do this to brainstorm ideas, for drinks, games, or just to catch up. We believe our team works best remotely, independently but collaboratively, and determine their own schedules amongst themselves.

We are an equal-opportunity employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment for all our employees. We celebrate and encourage our employee's differences in race, religion, colour, national origin, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, age, and disability

What You'll Do

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
About Us

At Sandwich Lab AI, we're on a mission to forge the future of work with one AI-powered breakthrough at a time. Our team envisions a world where AI and advanced language models aren't just fancy tools, but digital co-workers that solve problems, generate insights, and augment human creativity across countless industries.

Our team, with members from top research institutes and leading tech companies, is united by a clear vision: to shape an Al-driven future that transforms how the world does business. Right now, we're redefining advertising processes. Our technology blends sophisticated self-evolving Al algorithms, cutting-edge LLMs, and deep reasoning capabilities to supercharge ad campaigns - automatically adjusting creative assets, targeting parameters, and campaign structures for optimum results. But that's only our first chapter.

Our ultimate vision extends far beyond advertising: to introduce "digital employees" - AI-powered colleagues that seamlessly integrate into organizational workflows, performing specialized tasks, anticipating needs, and continuously self-improving. Imagine assigning a task and watching your digital employee tackle it with minimal guidance-thinking, learning, and acting alongside you. This opens the door to countless new possibilities and reshapes the future of work in ways we can only begin to imagine.

Enthusiastic about intelligent AI agents and LLM-powered colleagues? Join us on this journey of innovation and collaboration as we seek to transform ideas into reality. Be the visionary to spark change, the innovator to challenge convention, the architect to design tomorrow.

About You
  • You're pursuing a degree in Computer Science or a related field, with a solid grasp of algorithms, data structures, and system design.
  • You love coding in backend languages like Go, Python or Java and have built scalable systems, APIs, or microservices.
  • You're curious about AI/ML and eager to integrate SotA models and algorithms into real-world apps.
  • You thrive on solving complex problems, optimizing performance, and crafting efficient, scalable solutions.
  • You've worked with data pipelines, SQL/NoSQL databases, or distributed computing, and enjoy turning data into insights.
  • You value collaboration, clear communication, and thrive in a fast-paced, startup environment where ideas grow through iteration.
  • You're adaptable, always learning about new AI/ML trends, and ready to push boundaries.
  • You share our mission and excitement for shaping an AI-driven future-innovating, challenging the norm, and designing transformative technology.

Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:
NATURE AND SCOPE
The Operations Support Specialist works both in the Information Systems & Technology office and throughout the organization to facilitate the technology needs of the staff and faculty.

Interpersonal Contacts:
This position requires the incumbent to work collaboratively with a wide range of people in various positions including staff, instructors and faculty as well as with departmental staff. The incumbent will also be required to collaborate with a variety of IT professionals at the University of Waterloo to obtain, clarify and receive information.

Level of Responsibility:
The candidate is expected to maintain ownership and responsibility of a queue of requests that range in scope from software assistance, hardware faults, deployments, and special projects. The role has defined and standard tasks and receives guidance from the department Manager.

Decision Making:
The Technical Support Consultant needs to be able to identify problems and implement solutions with a minimum of direct supervision and should be capable of providing training and instruction where needed to end-users. The incumbent possesses decision-making authority based on established policy and procedure; complex and non-routine issues involve consultation with appropriate personnel.

Physical and Sensory Demands:
This role involves frequent lifting and moving of objects and most of the work is away from a desk. Peak times can include numerous requests, multiple priorities and frequent interruptions. Beginning of academic terms may require flexibility in terms of hours of work.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
  • Coordinate the triaging of IT help-desk requests along with the Information Technology Specialist
  • Communicate with end-users regarding technical issues
  • Installation, user training and support of hardware and software
  • Troubleshoot network printers and copiers
  • Maintain and troubleshoot classroom audio/visual technology
  • Install and remove network and audio/video cabling
  • Setup and teardown of portable audio equipment
  • Organize and maintain storage facilities
  • Collect, sort, and organize electronic waste
Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
The Technical Support Consultant, reporting to the Manager, Information Systems and Technology, is responsible for front-line response and resolution of help-desk requests and for maintaining and deploying hardware and software for staff, faculty, and facilities. The Technical Support Consultant is also a key support for classroom audio/visual technology and seeks to maintain a high degree of usability and uptime for technology across the college. Additionally, the incumbent will represent Renison in a manner consistent with the values and goals of the organization.

The role is full (35 hour per week) time onsite at Renison with flexible working hours. As part of small team, the incumbent will gain a wide variety of both technical and interpersonal skills. Renison is a small and tight knit community that is very patient and understanding.

Training is provided to help those with a less technical background to excel in the role.

Required Skills
  • Strong sense of customer service with a positive solution-oriented attitude
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to work with multiple priorities and deadlines
  • Superior communication skills, both oral and written
  • Strong interpersonal skills including demonstrated collaborative abilities and approachability
  • Effective organizational skills, with the ability to work with multiple priorities and deadlines
  • Knowledge of Windows, Mac, and mobile device hardware
  • Excellent troubleshooting skills
  • Proven ability to work independently and as part of a team in a busy and varied environment
  • Experience with AutoCAD an asset
  • Professional, tactful and diplomatic, with ability to maintain strict confidentiality

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
About Us:
Northly Media Group is Canada's fastest-growing media/news outlet on social media, connecting Canadians to their cities through a diverse network. Our primary target audience is Gen Z and young millennials, and we strive to distribute content in the most easily digestible way.

Job Summary
Are you ready to make your mark in the Canadian media scene? This isn't your typical internship-it's your chance to gain hands-on experience with Waveroom and Northly, two of Canada's fastest-growing media powerhouses. From curating the latest in news, entertainment, and culture to building content that reaches millions, this opportunity is all about amplifying your voice while learning from the best.

Here's the best part: You'll have full flexibility to work remotely, on your schedule, and at your own pace during the day. Whether you're balancing classes or side hustles, this role fits right into your life.

About Us
We're putting the spotlight on the next generation of Canadians-curating the best in news, fashion, art, food, sports, and entertainment. Waveroom and Northly have become the epicenter of GTA and Canadian culture, with a combined following of over 3 million Canadians and recognition from icons like Drake, Dragon's Den Investor Michele Romanow, and more.

Every day, hundreds of thousands of Canadians turn to us for hyper-local updates, trends, and things to do. Our mission? To celebrate Canada's unique voices and showcase the diverse perspectives that make this country extraordinary.

What You'll Do
  • Create Impactful Content: Contribute to content strategies, campaigns, and posts that reach millions of Canadians daily.
  • Trendspotting: Stay ahead of the curve by identifying the latest social media and cultural trends.
  • Collaborate: Work alongside a creative team passionate about building stories that resonate.
  • Learn & Grow: Dive into analytics, content creation, and community engagement while getting real-world experience.

Why You Should Apply
  • Flexible Schedule: Work remotely from anywhere and pick the hours that work best for you.
  • Resume Gold: Build your portfolio with real-world projects and gain experience working with some of the largest media pages in Canada.
  • Diverse Opportunities: Work on content for both Waveroom and Northly, giving you exposure to a wide range of audiences and platforms.
  • Be Part of Something Big: Join a media outlet that's shaping Canadian culture and has the attention of top influencers and leaders.
Qualifications (No Experience Required!)
No experience? No problem. We're here to help you grow! That said, if you have these, it's a plus:
  • A passion for social media, content creation, and Canadian culture.
  • Familiarity with Instagram, TikTok, or other social platforms.
  • Creativity, attention to detail, and a willingness to learn.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills:
No experience is required to apply for this role, but the following qualifications and skills are preferred:
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Familiarity with social media platforms (Instagram, TikTok, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, LinkedIn).
  • Proficiency in graphic design tools like Canva, Adobe Photoshop, or Illustrator (preferred but not required).
  • Basic understanding of social media analytics and insights.
  • A keen eye for trends in content, design, and social media strategies.
  • Ability to generate creative ideas and think outside the box.
  • Excellent time-management skills with the ability to multitask and meet deadlines.
  • Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills.
  • Interest in digital marketing, content creation, and branding.
  • A proactive attitude with a willingness to learn and contribute.
  • Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.
  • Open to feedback and eager to grow professionally.
  • Video editing skills (e.g., Premiere Pro, CapCut, Final Cut Pro).
  • Knowledge of content marketing.
  • Experience managing or growing personal/professional social media accounts.

This position supports the University of Waterloo Library's website, which is an essential tool for UW students and researchers. As part of the Digital Initiatives department, and working closely with other library areas such as User Experience, this position's primary focus will be assisting with a website content audit and redesign project. Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:
As a Fullstack Software Engineering Intern based out of our New York HQ you'll be responsible for building across the stack to support and delight tens of thousands of our clients.

From our award-winning mobile app (written in React Native) to our content generation and admin tools (written in React) to our backend systems that transact millions of dollars a day (node.js) all the way to our DB (mongo) you'll work on whatever part of the stack is necessary to deliver projects quickly, efficiently and securely.

You'll work closely senior members of the engineering team to ensure the continued stability, scalability and security of Titan's systems. You'll also work cross-functionally with our design, product and customer experience teams to deliver delightful experiences that have never before been seen in a financial product.
Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Titan is the rebel challenger in a very old industry. The present era is run by ancient players: Fidelity, Schwab, & Goldman Sachs. The problem is that none of them were built on modern rails and have horrible user experiences. There have been new things built (think: "investing apps"). They are either 1) gimmicky casinos or 2) sleepy commodities. We won't say names. Why hasn't anyone built a modern Goldman Sachs for everyone? That's our mission.

Titan is a next-generation investment firm. We aspire to lead our generations' wealth.

We are fighters at heart. We fight to build products that are truly democratized. For example, we launched the first institutional grade cash management product open to everyday investors via Titan Smart Cash. We launched the first ever Venture fund for everyday investors in partnership with Cathie Wood's ARK. We've been able to raise significant capital from some of Silicon Valley's best, like a16z and General Catalyst.

Now let's talk about you. We're highly selective with who we choose to bring onto the team, but if you resonate with the above, we'd love to meet you.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills:
We're looking for someone who has:
  • A strong technical background (with 2 or more internships experience) and has experience building applications using JavaScript / TypeScript.
  • Experience working across the stack from browser tweaks to get the rendering just right to storing new data in the database and everywhere in between.
  • A desire to get better everyday. Titan's best days are still to come and so are yours.
  • An ability to work in a fast paced environment with subject matter experts from across the company.
  • A strong sense of responsibility and integrity. We're a fiduciary of our clients and we always act with their best interests at heart.
  • Ability to work out of our NYC HQ - 3 days a week hybrid.

Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:
As a member of the Voiceflow Customer Support team, you will:
  • Be a founding member of the Voiceflow support function and collaborate with key functions including Engineering, Product and Leadership
  • Deliver above-and-beyond product support & customer service through Zendesk, Slack, Discord, email, and demos. Respond to customer inquiries/problems with a "customer first" attitude with a competent & professional communication style.
  • Listen, complete & conduct thorough product investigations with customer/user while understanding requirements & provide/direct timely and accurate information/requests to relevant stakeholders (ie. Product, Customer Success & Marketing) and/or suggest the most appropriate product action for them to take, or escalate accordingly.
  • Become a Voiceflow expert and subsequently a product advocate to help investigate, ideate and enable, support and activate our user base
  • Being the 'voice-of-the-customer' in ensuring that user & customer support feedback, insights, gaps, needs and/or metrics are documented & cascaded to cross-functional teams such as Product, Marketing, Customer Experience & Sales, in order to improve Voiceflow's offerings.
  • Pro-actively update/resolve customer requests or inquiries to customers & internal stakeholders, and provide timely feedback/resolution to stakeholders and/or customers. Answering detailed process questions by team members and ensuring all issues are resolved in a timely manner.
  • Overseeing the quality and efficiency of the Voiceflow Support function and ensuring all key performance metrics are being met
  • Work in a fast-paced, team environment with ability to train and assist other team members as needed
Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Join our team

Voiceflow is the leading collaborative conversational AI platform.

Our collaboration platform makes it easy for conversational AI product teams to quickly design, test, ship and iterate on conversational assistants - together, faster, at scale.
Assistants designed and built with Voiceflow span hundreds of use cases, from drive thrus to in-car assistants, call centres and more. Voiceflow is loved by over 80,000 global teams with some of the world's largest companies as customers including Google, BMW, US Bank, McDonalds, JP Morgan, Spotify, Amazon, Home Depot, Best Buy, John Hopkins, and thousands of others.

We're biassed of course, but we think we're building one of the coolest products in the world. Put this claim to the test and try out Voiceflow's free version yourself - give it a try!

Joining a new company is one of the biggest decisions we all make in life as we're investing our most important resource - our time. At Voiceflow, we're investing our time here because we believe in an inevitable future where many of the conversations we have with brands everyday will be increasingly automated. If that's the future we're all going to be a part of, then the world needs Voiceflow to ensure the teams building these conversational experiences have great tools to craft great experiences. Think of us like the Adobe creative suite for the growing world of conversational AI. You can learn more about our vision of the future here.

We've raised $25M USD the past 2 years from some of the world's best investors including Felicis, Craft, Openview, True, Amazon, Google & CEOs of Figma, Webflow, Eventbrite, Invision, Producthunt, and more. We're a small, fast growing remote team of around 40 team members from around the world, composed of dedicated and talented individuals with a core focus on engineering and product.

To support our rapid growth, we are looking for a Customer Support Intern.

As a founding member of the Customer Support & Customer Experience team, you will be an instrumental piece in sustaining and improving our customer offerings. We constantly strive to deliver an exceptional product and customer experience, and the Customer Experience role is where your extraordinary journey begins. Flowsters are inquisitive and investigative, extraordinary attention-to-detail and kind customer whisperers. We are looking for a candidate that has the ability to make every situation a positive one, while improving every day.

  • Can manage multiple initiatives, issues and priorities in a fast-paced collaborative environment.

  • Communicate: Prepare and deliver presentations and/or technical reports showcasing your work to different audiences.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Position Description:
We are looking for a Machine Learning Co-op to join our Research and Innovation team for an 8-month term (4-month term can be considered for an exceptional candidate).

As a Machine Learning Co-op, you will work side-by-side with the Research and Innovation team to develop our upcoming ultrasound-based imaging products. You do not need to have previous experience with ultrasound. You will be involved in applying modern deep learning research in areas such as supervised, self-supervised, reinforcement, and representation learning for ultrasound imaging modalities.

You will actively participate in industrial scientific research focused on state-of-the-art ultrasound imaging solutions. You will be working in a multidisciplinary team of scientists and engineers dedicated to advancing ultrasound technology. The ideal candidate is both scientifically minded and pragmatic, with a strong desire to work and grow in a fast-paced technology environment.

About DarkVision:

DarkVision Technologies Inc. is a Canada-based tech company disrupting the industrial imaging market since 2013. We have created the world's most advanced acoustic-based imaging platform. We are packaging it into multiple new product lines, revolutionizing how our clients quantify and visualize the integrity of their critical assets.

Backed by Koch Industries, one of the world's largest privately held companies, Darkvision's team of Mechanical, Skunkworks, Electrical, Software, and Machine Learning Engineers is rapidly expanding to meet the demand for the company's current and upcoming products. Our employees to work on cutting-edge technologies that blend science with real-world applications.

Building on its commercial success in the downhole market, we are transitioning into a much larger organization and have recently expanded into a state-of-the-art 52,000 sq ft facility in North Vancouver, BC. We are expanding globally by opening offices in the US and Norway. We invite you to join our team for the exciting journey ahead as we become the global leader in industrial imaging.

Why DarkVision:

Here are some of the reasons you'll like working at DarkVision:
  • Well-Funded: We are backed by Koch Industries - North America's largest privately held company, and actively work with top-tier operators across North America.
  • 'A' Players: Our team is made up of talented, intelligent, and hardworking people. If you're an 'A' player, you'll enjoy the intellectually stimulating, challenging and respectfully competitive atmosphere.
  • Creativity valued: Our employees enjoy considerable freedom and are encouraged to take calculated risks, fostering a culture that values creativity and out-of-the-box ideas.
  • Supportive mentorship: Many of our employees have participated in a co-op program themselves. We understand what it takes to ensure your success and personal development during a successful co-op term contributing to the company's achievements.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills:
Expectations:
  • Enrolled in a graduate program or in the 3rd or 4th year of an undergraduate program in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field.
  • Good working knowledge of one or more Machine Learning Frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow, JAX, etc.)
  • Experience with Python beyond basic Machine Learning scripting (i.e., Numpy and Pandas)
  • Strong communication and presentation skills.

What will put you ahead:
  • Proven track record of developing deep learning architectures from scratch
  • Proven track record of applying machine learning to real world problems
  • Proven track record of cutting-edge research in any machine learning modality
  • Knowledge of optimization in the context of deep learning

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
ABOUT VIREO INTERFACES
Vireo Interfaces is shaping the future of input for head-mounted displays. As smartglasses evolve toward mainstream adoption, hand tracking and EMG fall short for high-precision, high-bandwidth tasks. Our research-driven solution-a dominant-hand stylus and nondominant-hand touch-and-keypad-delivers the tactile control and efficiency needed for serious productivity in extended reality.

Vireo Interfaces is an early-stage VR tech startup in the Waterloo Region founded by a University of Waterloo Mechanical Engineering graduate. Our current projects include long-term prototype development of our flagship product, medium-term projects getting VR software, locomotion, and haptic solutions on the market, and short-term engineering contracts focused on revenue generation.

We are a growing team and are looking for talented individuals with passion for immersive computing to join our mission. We have opportunities available for all levels of commitment, ranging from occasional contract workers, co-op students, full-time employees, to co-founders. See more or introduce yourself through the contact form on our website at vireointerfaces.com.

ABOUT THE ROLE
As a VR Software Developer, you will take on responsibilities suited to your strengths in the areas of algorithm design and optimization, firmware development, developing plugins integrating android mobile apps and windows desktop apps, unity development, and data science. You will be expected to work reliably and with autonomy, taking ownership over large pieces of the ongoing projects.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills:
We expect you to have experience in multiple of the following areas:
  • VR development in Unity
  • Wrangling data and using R or python to create algorithmic or ML forecasting models
  • Understanding, writing the code for, and optimizing algorithms derived in academic papers and patents
  • AR android development using custom AR markers for tracking
  • Rigorous user testing and user-centered design
  • Creating realistic 3D PBR assets using modelling and texturing software such as Blender and Adobe Substance Painter, then lighting them efficiently in Unity
  • Writing and deploying C and C++ code for STM32 and Arduino
  • Using FreeRTOS and its task scheduling API
  • Personal experience using VR, and understanding of the existing input devices and techniques
In addition, we expect you to have the problem-solving skills, flexibility, and grit required to work in a startup environment. You must have self-motivation, the ability to learn quickly, and confidence in taking ownership of projects. You should have understanding of the basic principles of Human-Computer Interaction and User Experience, and a passion for seeing Virtual Reality develop as a creativity and productivity tool.$18.00-$26.00/hr

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
We're a team of friendly, innovative and supportive co-op communications professionals - writers, content strategists, designers, web managers - who work to produce content for student and employer audiences. We're all about creative solutions and collective success.

We're looking for a passionate and creative mind to work with us as a Web Associate. You'll work closely with our team of experts as we expand and upgrade our web presence and help maintain our digital communication efforts on our websites. We're currently working on a few large-scale website maintenance/governance projects that you will get to be a part of! Over the co-op term, you'll leverage your skills in digital communications, web maintenance, web accessibility and web design to push beyond our current digital state.

Some of the benefits of joining our team are:
  • A hybrid flexible work environment
  • Monthly team socials include trivia, outdoor activities, team competitions, and potlucks!
  • Bi-weekly team meetings and celebrations
  • An inclusive & diverse team that creates a space for everyone
  • Exposure to learning and development opportunities like webinars, conferences and workshops
  • Collaboration with a variety of experienced communication, digital and engagement professionals
We can't wait to see what you bring to this role! Join our team for a great work term!

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
The Impact Assessment Agency of Canada (IAAC) is responsible for evaluating major projects' environmental, economic, and social impacts to ensure informed decision-making. We are committed to modernizing our processes, with a strong focus on leveraging AI to enhance efficiency and reduce timelines while maintaining rigorous assessments.

We are seeking an IT student to support our AI mandate, working alongside a team exploring innovative applications of artificial intelligence within the Agency. This is a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in AI, digital transformation, and public sector innovation.

Student Opportunity: IT Student in AI

Are you passionate about artificial intelligence and its impact on public service? Are you eager to gain hands-on experience in a dynamic government environment? The Impact Assessment Agency of Canada (IAAC) is looking for students to support AI-driven initiatives that enhance our work in assessing major projects across Canada.

You should be:

  • Detail-oriented with strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Start Date: Tuesday May 20, 2025 (Monday May 12, 2025 is also allowed if preferred)
End Date: Friday August 29, 2025

Transify is a Toronto-based startup that's working on a data platform for transit agencies. Our data platform visualizes the data generated by GPS and passenger counter devices onboard buses to help transit planning and operations staff optimize bus service. You can learn more at https://transify.com

Our stack consists of React in the frontend and Python, Django, and Pandas in the backend. We conduct code reviews and will work closely with the student to ensure that their skills will improve throughout the term.

As a small early-stage startup, the student will have the opportunity to own new features, interact with clients, and help come up with improvements to the product. Here's a testimonial from a recent co-op student:

"Highly recommend Transify for motivated, passionate individuals who want to grow. I was given significant ownership opportunities that pushed me to think deeply about both the product side and the engineering side, as well as the freedom to pursue my ideas to improve existing processes. Very happy that I was able to learn and accomplish so much here during my four months."

Maple Leaf Foods is Canada's leading consumer packaged meats company, headquartered in Mississauga, Ontario. We're a carbon neutral food company on a purposeful journey to Raise the Good in Food through better nutrition, safer food and workplaces, more humane animal care, and environmental sustainability efforts that protect our planet. We care about our communities and commit to reducing food insecurity in Canada. Join us on the journey. Let's build a better future, together.

We're passionate about food. For more than 100 years, we've made delicious, healthy protein that Canadians love under iconic national and regional brands, like Maple Leaf®, Schneiders®, and Greenfield Natural Meat Co.® We're on a journey to become the most sustainable protein company - not just in Canada - but on earth.
  • We are carbon neutral.
  • We are one of the only food companies in Canada to set science-based targets.
  • We aim to reduce our environmental footprint by 50% by 2025
A diverse and inclusive work environment
Championing diversity and inclusion is a critical component to advancing our collective purpose and vision and living the Maple Leaf Leadership Values. We believe in building, investing in, recognizing, and rewarding remarkable people who value an inclusive workplace, embrace all forms of diversity, and commit to including every voice in our collaborative environment. We're so much stronger when we know we're accepted and valued for who we are and what we each bring to the workplace.
We embrace a strong, values-based culture
Our eight Leadership Values are our north star. They guide the decisions we make for all our stakeholders: our consumers, our customers, our people, our communities, our shareholders, and the environment. Doing What's Right, Shared Value, High Performance, Diverse and Inclusive Teams, Disciplined Decision Making, Our Accountability, Intense Curiosity, Transparency and Humility.
Information Solutions
Do you have a passion for technology and a desire to build, deploy and maintain world-class IT systems? Being a part of the Maple Leaf Information Solutions team means joining a mission to deliver, support and improve the information systems and infrastructure that enable our people to manage the business.

As part of our diverse team of talented professionals, you will be fueled by a passion for technology and a desire to build, deploy and maintain world-class systems. Embracing emerging technology and process leadership are important, as our people work collaboratively with cross-functional business teams and vendors to optimize value for the organization.

Benefits

  • Support to participate in community outreach events and initiatives

Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities & opportunities in this role:
  • Create real demos showing that the Groq LPU™ AI Inference Technology is the fastest way to run LLMs and other GenerativeAI applications (here [link for "here" htgroq.com/showcases/project-stockbot/] tps://is an example)
  • Create examples of Language User Interfaces (LUIs) enabling HumanPlus, demonstrating how individuals take advantage of advancements in AI technology
  • Collaborate with Brand and Marketing on content for prompt engineering tutorials, social content, customer API documentation, and user experience feedback to Product
  • Attend and support Bay Area industry events including hackathons, developer meetups, and conferences
Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Our promise to customers, partners, and prompters is always and forever to make it real. This internship offers an excellent opportunity to gain firsthand experience in AI application engineering with our Brand Team and a chance to contribute to special projects and initiatives that make Groq real.

As a Brand Team Intern, you will help demonstrate an idea we at Groq call "HumanPlus." This is when humans, particularly in professional roles, enhance and maximize their skills by seamlessly integrating AI, such as Large Language Models (LLMs), into their creative and work processes. Whether it's generating code for non-programmers, writing poetically for programmers, or creating images for marketers, LLMs are transforming the way people interact with technology. The ability to interface, communicate, and collaborate with machines using natural language is a powerful aspect of HumanPlus. For more information, check out a recent blog post by Mark Heaps, VP of Brand and Senior Tech Evangelist.

We are searching for a unique individual who can both showcase their technical skills as an apps engineer and collaborate on content creation. You will work on building demos of AI technology integrated with LLMs, audio models and image generation models to show the potential of HumanPlus when running on the LPU AI Inference Technology by Groq; and you will have the opportunity to present to AI communities and business audiences. You will work cross-functionally with an experienced, dedicated fun team in a dynamic environment that values growth and development. Check out our Showcase page to see examples of applications current and past AI Applications Engineering Interns have built. We look forward to meeting you and providing you with a valuable learning experience.

  • Familiarity with traditional web technologies such as javascript, html, css. Some web development skills and cloud deployment experience are a big plus.
  • Familiarity in building applications that leverage API endpoints such as OpenAI.
  • Familiarity with use cases for LLMs on their own or combined with other components such as voice and database.
  • Located in the San Francisco Bay Area. Being local to the Bay Area to help support various industry events is a big plus.
Attributes of a Groqstar:
  • Humility - Egos are checked at the door
  • Collaborative & Team Savvy - We make up the smartest person in the room, together
  • Growth & Giver Mindset - Learn it all versus know it all, we share knowledge generously
  • Curious & Innovative - Take a creative approach to projects, problems, and design
  • Passion, Grit, & Boldness - no limit thinking, fueling informed risk taking

Responsibilities & opportunities in this role:
  • Develop Innovative AI Demos: Create compelling, real-world applications and tutorials that highlight the speed and low latency of the Groq LPU™ Inference Engine for AI applications.
  • Contribute to Developer Resources: Collaborate on content for prompt engineering tutorials, API documentation, and bring back user experience feedback to Product.
  • Expand our GroqChamps Program: Help manage and grow our GroqChamps developer advocacy program, engaging with our community and providing support and guidance.
  • Enhance Developer Support: Contribute to the development and maintenance of our developer support AI bot for Discord, including updating code and integrating the bot into our community support platform.
  • Enhance Developer Experience: Collaborate with the Developer Relations & Support team to identify areas for improvement and develop solutions to support our developer community.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
At Groq, we're committed to making AI accessible and empowering developers to build world changing AI applications. Our Developer Relations & Support team is looking for a talented intern to help us build, maintain, and grow our community platform, develop example AI applications, and interact with our developer community to encourage, reward, and support building on Groq.

As a Developer Relations & Support Intern, you will have the opportunity to work on exciting projects that showcase the power of Groq API for lightning-fast inference. You will be responsible for developing example applications that demonstrate the capabilities of our Groq API, helping to manage and grow our GroqChamps developer program, writing compelling developer documentation, and interacting with and supporting our developer community online and in-person at events.

We are searching for a unique individual who can both showcase their technical skills as an apps engineer and collaborate with developers to help them build. You will work on building demos of AI technology integrated with LLMs, audio models, and image generation models; and you will have the opportunity to present to AI communities and business audiences. You will work cross-functionally with an experienced, dedicated fun team in a dynamic environment that values growth and development.

This hands-on opportunity is designed to immerse you in the exciting world of ETFs, investment analysis, and strategic product development. You will collaborate with experienced professionals, contribute to real projects, and gain invaluable insights into the investment management landscape.


About Us:
Global X Investments Canada Inc. ("Global X") is an innovative financial services company that offers one of the largest suites of exchange-traded funds in Canada. The Global X Fund family includes a broadly diversified range of solutions for investors of all experience levels to meet their investment objectives in a variety of market conditions. Global X currently has more than $38 billion of assets under management and over 130 ETFs as of December 31, 2024, listed on major Canadian stock exchanges. Global X is a wholly owned subsidiary of the Mirae Asset Financial Group, which manages approximately $800 billion of assets across 19 countries and global markets around the world.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
At Groq IT, we're superb troubleshooters with a wide range of tools in our toolkit. We handle "traditional" systems administration tasks, development of internal tools and automation to make our work better, office/lab support, and general troubleshooting of a wide range of systems. We leverage as much SaaS as possible, so we're constantly forging connections between disparate systems while looking for ways to eliminate technical debt. We support Linux, macOS and Windows in our mission to support a wide range of needs across Groq.
An internship with the Information Technology group at Groq offers several opportunities, from those who want to work in Systems Administration to Application Development. In IT, we strive for as much automation as possible for our internal tools and for external connections, and we have several projects as well as ad hoc activities to keep us occupied.

  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail

Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities: As a physics simulation intern, your primary goal will be to qualitatively and quantitatively characterize the effects of backscattering and multiple-scattering on a LiDAR device sending its signal in an underwater environment.
Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Phantom Photonics is seeking highly motivated and skilled individuals to join our dynamic team and drive the advancement of cutting-edge quantum-enhanced remote sensing technologies. Our innovative sensors leverage quantum coherence and time-bin interferometers, integrated with single-photon detector arrays on the hardware side, and exploit novel signal processing strategies. These advancements enable us to provide state-of-the-art quantum-enhanced solutions in remote sensing and imaging. These roles are crucial in expanding our capabilities across various remote sensing applications, pushing the boundaries of what is possible in the field. The company founder is a Waterloo Alumni.

Do you have an interest in applying novel concepts from computer science to create numerical simulations that model physical phenomena? Phantom Photonics is looking to augment our current simulations of underwater optical transmission with ideas from raytracing.

In our quest to enhance the capabilities of underwater LiDAR technology with ideas from quantum mechanics, we encounter backscattering and multiple scattering as sources of disturbance. Using raytracing techniques to simulate these effects, we can find ways to improve and optimize ranging performance.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills:
Required experience:
  • Programming
  • Linear algebra
  • Calculus
Nice-to-have:
  • Python experience, especially with numerical libraries like NumPy and SciPy; basic familiarity with quantum mechanics; experience with computer graphics concepts.
  • A course in optics.
VERY Nice-to-have:
  • Zemax, or any other raytracing software experience.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
The NRC/ Digital Technologies Research Center The National Research Council (NRC) is the Government of Canada's largest research organization supporting industrial innovation, the advancement of knowledge and technology development. It represents a powerful partnering option for anyone looking to push the boundaries of science and industry.
Your challenge As a student joining NRC, you will undertake career-related projects in an engaging and intellectually-stimulating environment.
The ideal candidate will be a key member of a multidisciplinary team of researchers specializing in natural language and image processing. The team is working on cutting-edge of AI technology known as Visual Language Models (VLMs). VLMs are emerging as a transformative force, significantly impacting the entertainment, digital asset management, security, and both traditional and social media industries. The team's primary focus is on enhancing the Explainability of VLM-generated results for end users.
Within this dynamic team, the candidate will be responsible for exploring and testing a variety of open source and close source VLMs for generating human-understandable and useful explanations.
Additionally, the candidate will evaluate the performance of these models, identifying specific applications where certain models excel over others for particular tasks.
Length of term Student work terms last for approximately sixteen weeks (four months) based on a schedule of 37.5 hours per week.
Who is eligible You are eligible for the NRC Co-op Program if you attend a Canadian university/college, are enrolled in a recognized co-op program, possess a minimum of a B average and are a Canadian citizen or a permanent resident of Canada. Alternatively, foreign national students who meet the eligibility requirements, are studying in a recognised and eligible Canadian educational institution and possess a valid Co-op Work Permit may also apply.
Condition of employment:
  • Security clearance at the reliability level
Application requirements Please include the following documents with your application:
  • A cover letter
  • A resume
  • University/college transcripts
Notes The NRC is committed to the principles of employment equity and to achieving a workforce that is representative of the Canadian population. We encourage candidates to self-identify if they are an aboriginal person, a member of a visible minority group, a person with a disability or a woman.
We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment processes and work environments. If you require an accommodation in order to participate in the hiring process, please inform us in advance to make your needs known. Information received relating to accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.
We thank all students for showing interest in working at NRC CRC; however, only selected candidates will be contacted.
NRC values
  • Integrity - Behaving at all times ethically, honestly and objectively; being impartial and transparent with our colleagues, collaborators, stakeholders, clients and the people of Canada; and exercising sound stewardship of our resources,
  • Excellence - Pursuing excellence in all that we do - in our research and innovation, in our collaborations, in execution of our programs, in our support to firms, and in our delivery of our common corporate services.
  • Respect - Valuing and respecting the knowledge, expertise, and diversity of our colleagues, our workplace, our collaborators, our stakeholders and our clients to have an impact on Canada and the world.
  • Creativity - Harnessing our imagination, passion for excellence, scientific exploration, technology and innovation to generate new knowledge, new technologies, new business processes, and new collaborations for a better NRC and a better world.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
CMLS Financial, one of Canada's largest Commercial lenders, is looking for a Summer Student to join our growing team.
The Summer Student will report directly to the Director of CMHC Commercial Lending and will be responsible for collaborating with various stakeholders in the creation and organization of a central SharePoint site.

Who are we?
Established in 1974, CMLS Financial is the leading provider of capital solutions for commercial property owners, developers and real estate investors. We have over 50 years of experience, 30,000 clients, $45 billion in assets under administration, and offices coast to coast. Some of Canada's most prominent banks, investment managers, insurance companies, and pension funds rely on CMLS Financial for a variety of critically important services. Building on our solid foundation of financial strength and experience, we continue to deliver unparalleled capital solutions for all our clients needs.

You will love working here
Employees tell us that they love that we strike the balance in creating an incredibly professional, yet dynamic and enjoyable corporate culture. We work in a fluid and fast-paced environment that is supportive of energetic and motivated individuals who pride themselves on being flexible and results-driven. Our employees are able to gain valuable industry exposure, lots of learning opportunities, and truly impact the business. We are committed to providing our people with a challenging and rewarding career because our employees are what set us apart and we know it.

Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:
How you'll make an impact
  • Collaborate with the Solutions Engineering team to design and develop solutions that leverage Geotab's ecosystem to our customer's challenges. This includes creating proof-of-concept models, identifying key features and assessing potential impacts to customer requirements.
  • Support and maintain team solutions through further development, documentation or cross-team training.
  • Provide technical project management support as needed for team projects.
  • Prepare accurate and concise technical documentation, reports, and presentations related to sustainability initiatives and solution development.
  • Communicate project progress, challenges, and outcomes to relevant stakeholders.
  • Assist in the coordination and execution of projects, including data collection, performance monitoring, and analysis.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure project milestones are achieved within established timelines.
  • Stay informed about emerging trends, technologies, and industry standards. Identify opportunities for improvement in Geotab's ecosystem and propose innovative alternatives.
Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Who you are:
We are always looking for amazing talent who can contribute to our growth and deliver results! Geotab is seeking a Solutions Engineering Intern who will closely work with the Solutions Engineering Team to develop solutions and documentation to support department initiatives. This may include the development of tools and processes, technical project or program management, data mining and analysis, and collaboration with cross-functional teams. If you love technology, have strong analytical skills, and are keen to join an industry leader - we would love to hear from you!

What you'll do:
As a Solutions Engineering Intern, your key area of responsibility will be developing and supporting solutions that address department initiatives. This includes tasks such as designing and developing solutions in collaboration with the Solutions Engineering team, creating proof-of-concept models, and assessing the impacts of customer requirements. You will also support team solutions through documentation, training, and further development, as well as provide technical project management support. Additionally, you will be responsible for coordinating project milestones, monitoring performance, and providing status updates to relevant stakeholders. You will need to work closely with Geotab's Solutions Engineering, Product, and Engineering teams, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure timely project delivery and the successful implementation of initiatives.
To be successful in this role, you will be a self-starter with strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to quickly grasp technical concepts. In addition, the successful candidate will have strong analytical skills, effective project management capabilities, and an ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks and timelines efficiently to ensure results are delivered on time.

The opportunity
  • 4 month work-term beginning May 2025.
  • Full-time, paid internship: Monday - Friday, 37.5hrs/week.
  • Your first week at Geotab begins with 'GEO Launch' - a one-week Employee Orientation. Click here to learn more!
  • Learn more about the Geotab Campus Program here.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills:
What you'll bring to the role
  • Completing a post secondary degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Science or any other related field.
  • 1+ years experience with data science tools, SQL (Google Big Query preferred).
  • Familiarity with programming languages such as Python, JS, HTML, React.
  • Familiarity with API integrations, some ability to develop, maintain and/or troubleshoot issues.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to problem-solve to well-judged decisions.
  • Strong aptitude for understanding technical and business requirements. Ability to understand reasoning for project requirements.
  • High accuracy and meticulous attention to detail.
  • Able to work well under pressure and respond to fast changing priorities and deadlines.
  • Strong project management skills; able to identify needs, develop effective solutions and manage projects through to completion.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Willingness to learn and a strong work ethic and passion for technology and innovation.
  • Self-motivated and able to work independently as well as part of a team.
  • Prior experience or exposure to Telematics, connected vehicle technology, or related fields is a plus.

Job Posting Information.Compensation and Benefits: We have flexible hours, a casual environment, free snacks and beverages, excellent salaries and a co-op stock option program. Co-op students are entitled (and encouraged) to take a loaner system home for the duration of their employment.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:
As a Kaleidescape Embedded Applications Engineer, you will contribute directly to our line of devices which our end customers install in their home. This includes movie players such as the Strato V and movie servers to allow our customers to build their movie library (our movies are downloaded, not streamed).

You will advance the state of the art in the application which manages the movie library and delivers our beautiful, award-winning on-screen interface (OSD). Even in this microcosm, the application is a distributed application which may host embedded databases on multiple movie servers and may present the OSD on multiple movie players for multiple viewing zones.

Depending on your strengths and interests, you may
  • work alongside the user-experience (UX) team to realize new designs and features,
  • collaborate with the head-end (HE) team to synchronize and deliver data between the embedded application and the cloud to enable new experiences,
  • grow and modernize our embedded database backend to provide our interfaces with richer metadata at a moment's notice, or
  • develop and enhance the high-performance media playback engine to ensure our viewers never see a glitch when the show is on.
We're looking for outstanding computer science and engineering students who aren't afraid to make meaningful contributions to our customers' experiences. Successful candidates will join our team of full-time software developers, many of whom came from the Waterloo co-op program themselves.

We are a C++ house, with a significant portion of our codebase written in house. The quality of your code can directly impact the customer's movie night, so we look for clean, well-written code with a solid understanding of memory management and concurrency. Given the in-house codebase, expect a steep learning curve. Nonetheless, to those that are capable, the codebase is your oyster: you will have the autonomy to propose changes where necessary.
Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
About Kaleidescape
Kaleidescape is the ultimate movie platform. We bring the most authentic and cinematic movie-viewing experience to home theatres and yachts around the world. We do this by offering the largest collection of movies in the highest fidelity of any online retailer paired with the Kaleidescape Strato V - the best-in-class 4K Dolby Vision movie player with our award-winning user interface that is legendary within our sales channel.

Our products provide a beautiful, simple and intuitive user experience for enjoying movies at home, with creative and unique features to make the most of your home theatre or TV room. If you want a premium home entertainment experience that just works, then you need a Kaleidescape system.

Our people
Great products don't simply build themselves. At Kaleidescape, talented, passionate and committed individuals come together as a team to build products and features that we are truly proud of. And our team is more than just designers and testers - we are end-users too, as every employee is encouraged to set up and enjoy a home loaner system.

Our culture
We are an agile team that values the time we spend together. We gather for lunch and learn sessions every Wednesday over a free meal, sprint demos every other Wednesday. In the summer we hold weekly BBQs outside every other week, and we're just a short walk from the St. Jacob's farmer's market. We provide a theatre room for video games or quick movie breaks. We also celebrate our accomplishments with off-site events.

We value creativity, intelligence, and team collaboration centered on a strong work ethic and a disciplined approach. Our team is full of great talent more than happy to mentor you and level up your skills.

About Kaleidescape Engineering
We are a small team. Providing the world's best online movie store together with the best movie player involves intense and fascinating challenges. Our team develops all aspects of the platform including,
  • Headend services
    • Customer movie store
    • Channel dealer portals
    • Back-ends to support the above and customer system communications
  • Embedded devices (in the customer's home)
    • Animated onscreen user interface
    • Browser-based configuration interface
    • Media playback engines
    • Platform abstraction layers
    • Custom-built real-time Linux distribution
  • iOS, Android mobile applications
Success requires us to be collaborative and multifaceted as we evolve our user-facing features and take our customer experience to the next level.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills:
• Strong C++ programming and debugging skills
  • Solid understanding of memory management and concurrency
  • Great object-oriented software development fundamentals
  • Preference given to those with embedded programming experience (your code will not run on your computer)
  • Must have a passion for learning with strong collaborative instincts
  • For OSD development track

Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:
You won't be bored! As an Software Engineering Intern, you will work closely with your team and others to understand, design and code deliverables. You will be part of a scrum engineering team tasked with introducing new concepts and technologies into the product. You will have the tools and team to deliver fully functional code to our production environments. That means you'll have an understanding of how the stack works, gaining experience in all facets of development and making you a better developer. You'll gain experience with all the modern tools for software engineering in a cloud environment.
  • Attend your team's daily scrum meeting to exchange progress and plan what you are going to do for the day
  • Work on the same tasks as the rest of the team - we do not have "co-op projects"
  • Develop, deploy and verify your code - we embrace a DevOps mentality of ownership over the whole kit and kaboodle
  • Share your excitement and ideas about new technology
Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
At SPS Commerce, we strive to deliver a workplace where people feel valued and challenge each other to excel. Our teams are self-managing, and collaborative, and work without hierarchy or ego. SPS Commerce's Analytics Engineering Team serves to enable retailers and manufacturers to become more efficient by giving them access to what's happening in their business in flexible and collaborative ways. In joining this team, you will have a fantastic opportunity to use new technologies and patterns to build and manage several enterprise-level production services. You will join a team full of engineers who are not afraid to ask "why" and dig into the details. We have two sprint teams split between our offices in Brampton, Ontario and Parsippany, New Jersey, and we work closely together every day.

Does this sound like you?
  • You like solving challenging problems
  • You like learning and working with modern technologies, patterns, and skills
  • You like working in an agile environment
  • You want to be treated like a co-worker - not an intern
  • You're highly collaborative - you believe the best solutions come from working together
Why SPS?
  • You will have an excellent opportunity to learn and grow
    • Our office is a modern, open-concept, collaborative environment
    • Co-ops are treated like full-time team members - the same expectations, the same workload, and the same training
    • We provide many opportunities for growing your technical skills including tech meetups, lunch and learns, and other hands-on training
    • You'll have lots of opportunities to grow your collaborative and presentation skills through hackathons, internal tech conferences, programming guilds, happy hours, and employee groups like our Women in Tech and Diversity and Inclusion groups.
    • Work closely with a team of developers through the use of mob and pair programming. The team is always there to have your back.
  • We all share an understanding that we win as a team, and we lose as a team. No egos, no heroes.
  • You will be welcomed into a friendly, social atmosphere
    • We have a dedicated games room with gaming consoles, foosball, and bubble hockey
    • We play a variety of board games over lunch and occasionally after hours
  • Our location is across from the Bramalea mall
    • There is plenty of shopping, free parking, a gym, and a variety of restaurants
    • Affordable housing options are plentiful
    • Public transit (buses and GO terminal)
Hybrid Work Environment

Our tech teams are currently working from home, coming into the office about once a month. Our managers and above are in the office at least once a week, and other teams in the office come in once a week.

Application Information.Additional Application Information:
Applying for the position
The only requirements for the submission package are a Resume, Coop History, and Grades. The step below is an OPTIONAL bonus, but it can set you apart as a candidate.

If you have something exceptional to share, please reference it in a simple cover letter or provide a link to it in your resume. Showcasing work on an agentic or otherwise technically challenging software you have invested substantial effort into can set you apart. If you want to impress us with your work, we would like to see a detailed walkthrough of a project you are most proud of. Ideally, it would be a 20-minute screen recording that includes a demo of the application (project) running end-to-end, with:
  1. A step-by-step walkthrough of the source code
  2. Either your git commit logs as viewed from the terminal or a view of your contributions over time in GitHub insights
  3. A presentation of your project's "most technically challenging" parts and how you overcome those challenges in your code

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
At onsemi, we help improve lives through silicon and software solutions every day. Our intelligent power and sensing technologies solve the world's most complex challenges and lead the way in creating a safer, cleaner, and smarter world. We're developing leading-edge wireless-enabled MCUs, DSPs and software that sense and connect the world or help manage personal health through body worn or implantable devices. Our world-class ultra-low power solutions contribute to a more sustainable future. We are committed to developing strategies and programs to address global climate change and have pledged to achieve net-zero emissions by 2040. We invite you to join our innovative team and truly make a difference in people's lives.

onsemi is a Fortune 500 company and has been named one of the World's Most Ethical Companies by the Ethisphere Institute for the past 7 years in a row. In 2023, onsemi was recognized as one of the Waterloo Area's Top Employers by Canada's Top 100 Employers for the 4th time.

This position will be focused on automated test development, integration of software tools into our workflow (such as Docker, Jenkins, Jira) and working to improve the quality of our Software Development Kits (SDKs) for embedded systems. The ideal candidate for this position has a passion for programming with an interest in embedded systems, quality assurance, automation, Bluetooth and audio.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Toronto/ GTA
The Opportunity:
WSP is currently seeking co-op students starting in Spring 2025 for Construction Inspection roles in our Rail & Transit Department. You will assist with providing support for construction management services with a large transit client based at a designated project site within the Toronto City limits. This position offers a good opportunity to gain valuable experience in the administration of construction contracts and contract administration for capital works projects. Other experience gained under this assignment includes familiarity with track and signal, municipal servicing and infrastructure construction which will be very helpful to those who ultimately wish to pursue a career in this field in either a design or construction management. All work locations are within the city of Toronto, and accessible by transit (free TTC transit pass provided during work term).

Why WSP?
  • We value and are committed to upholding a culture of Inclusion and Belonging
  • Our Flexible Work Policy - we recognize the importance of balance in our lives and encourage you to prioritize the balance in yours. We will support you on and off the job so you can be fully present in both your work and home lives.
  • Our Hybrid Work Policy - a combination of in-person and remote working, enables us to purposefully think of how we work, who we need to work with, and where the work should be done.
  • A Canadian success story - we're proud to wear the red and white of this beautiful country and show the world what Canada has to offer.
  • Enhance the world around you - from the environment to the highways, to the buildings and the terrain, WSP is the fabric of Canada.
  • Outstanding career opportunities - we're growing and pushing ourselves every day to be greater than yesterday - we're open to your ideas and trying new things.
  • A phenomenal collaborative culture and a workforce filled with genuinely good people who are doing humbly important work. Come find out for yourself what it's like to be a part of our journey.
We offer attractive pay, flexible work options, a great corporate culture, comprehensive and employee-focused benefits including virtual healthcare and a wellness platform as well as great savings programs, and a clear vision for the future.
#WeAreWSP

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Mobile Data Technologies, an Alberta Venture "Fastest 50" Company is seeking a Coop Software Developer to keep pace with expanding sales and product development. The primary responsibility for this position will be to design, create and maintain software control systems. Ideally this developer will work out of our main office in Edmonton but depending on experience and overall fit we will be considering candidates working remotely within North America.

MDT has become the leader in control systems for a variety of equipment in the oil and gas industry. Using a combination of hardware and software controls, their unique, easy-to-use control interfaces are in high demand. By building on a core framework of control and HMI software, they are rapidly deploying an increasing number of control applications to an expanding market.

What's in it for you?
  • Great potential for personal growth
  • An entrepreneurial environment, open to new ideas and expanding technologies
  • An industry leading software platform with leading edge technologies
  • Interesting, complex control problems to solve
  • A commitment to fun (are you the next foosball champion?)
  • An excellent remuneration package
  • A dynamic leadership team, fostering success
  • It's true: this isn't just your typical nine to five job. This position is for someone who is ready to take control over their career. An amazing path is ready and waiting for the right candidate. Is it you?

Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:
The FRA will work on different projects spearheaded by the Risk Management Division (RMD) at the OFA, under the supervision of their manager and other senior staff members. Some of the anticipated projects may include: dashboard reporting, portfolio composition/benchmarking, fixed income maturities analysis, and data modelling and analysis, data validation, financial engineering, enterprise risk management. The FRA will also work with other team members to learn about their reporting procedures and documentation and improve upon them where appropriate.

Finally, the FRA will be trained and be responsible for running and distributing daily reports produced by the RMD teams, some on a rotational basis. The FRA will also be responsible for checking data inputs and other elements of monthly reports produced by other staff. Once trained, the FRA will be expected to work on these reports independently. The FRA may also have the opportunity to produce some monthly reports under the supervision of a senior staff member.
Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
The Financial Risk Analyst (FRA) will be responsible for a project/projects undertaken within the Risk Management Division ("Risk Operations Team" or "Data Analytics & Enterprise Risk Management Team"). The project(s) will be tailored to the FRA's background and technical experience. The FRA will also undertake some of the team's daily reporting requirements.

Career Development and Training:
The FRA will gain experience and background in the valuation of fixed income instruments and related investment products, including options, swaps, bonds, money market instruments, and others. The intern will receive hands-on experience with financial risk management and elements of portfolio performance measurement, and experience in enterprise risk management. Through technical research project/projects, the FRA will learn cutting edge ideas in modern finance, may gain hands-on experience with statistical methods and financial engineering, and have an opportunity to present their findings to an audience of peers. Through interaction with other OFA staff, the FRA will have opportunities to learn other aspects of capital market activities and financial reporting. Most importantly, the FRA will learn how to perform in a professional environment.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills: Strong quantitative skills, primarily math/statistics. Excellent data analysis skills. Microsoft Office, primarily Word/Excel and MS Access, Power BI. Strong technical and programming skills including: Python, VBA, and SQL. Ability to summarize detailed information and analysis. Excellent written and spoken English language skills. Ability to carry out multiple assignments within tight time frames. Knowledge of finance and financial instruments, and understanding of domestic and international capital markets is a plus.
