Job Summary:
About ApplyBoard's School products division
  • The ApplyBoard School products division is redefining global student enrollment with modern, AI-powered products designed for today's educational institutions. Our platform empowers universities and colleges to recruit, engage, and enroll best-fit students-efficiently and at scale. By combining advanced data models with real-time market insights, we eliminate manual processes and simplify complex workflows, enabling institutions to focus on what truly matters: unlocking student potential.
  • We're building more than just technology-we're shaping the future of global education. Our team is a diverse group of innovators, problem-solvers, tech and education enthusiasts dedicated to transforming how institutions connect with students worldwide.
  • We believe in curiosity, collaboration, and bold ideas. Whether it's engineering seamless workflows, designing intuitive experiences, or delivering actionable insights, every team member plays a crucial role in making enrollment smarter, faster, and more impactful.
  • If you're passionate about using technology to solve real-world challenges and want to be part of a team driving meaningful change in global education, ApplyBoard's School products division is the place for you.

Titanium Agency is a performance marketing agency located in the heart of Uptown Waterloo. We're a small, but mighty team of talented individuals who love to solve challenges through teamwork and collaboration. We keep the bureaucracy to a minimum and believe in putting the right people in roles where they'll thrive. That's why we're big on autonomy, ongoing learning, asking the tough questions, and taking calculated risks.

Students at Titanium are offered all the opportunities our full-time staff enjoy. If you are intelligent, hard working and ambitious, the sky is the limit for you here. Everyone here is given as much responsibility as they can manage.

Job Responsibilities:
Huawei Canada has an immediate co-op opening for an Engineer.

About the team:

The Heterogeneous Compiler Lab, led by esteemed technical experts with extensive industry and academic experience, publishes innovative research at leading conferences. Recognized as key contributors to the LLVM Compiler Infrastructure project, this lab excels in developing diversified IP compiler collaborations, focusing on AI, GPU, and CPU architectures. Our efforts include heterogeneous compilation technology and SW-HW co-design, optimizing for AI, graphics, games, and mobile applications while tackling technological challenges through open-source community.

About the job:
  • Design, develop, and test software to satisfy business requirements in a wide range of products, possibly including (but not limited to):
  • Compilers targeting next-generation mobile, network, or server hardware
  • Language runtimes for new programming languages
  • System-level optimization of deep learning frameworks
  • Concurrent programming frameworks and distributed systems that can scale from embedded devices to cloud services

  • Participate in scrums and project planning
  • Learn and adopt new technologies; research, survey, and present industry trends to the team
Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
About Huawei
With 194,000 employees and operating in more than 170 countries and regions, Huawei is a leading global creator and provider of information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure and smart devices. Integrated solutions span across four key domains - telecom networks, IT, smart devices, and cloud services. Huawei is committed to bringing digital to every person, home and organization for a fully connected, intelligent world.

About Huawei Canada
Huawei Canada focuses on fundamental research and development aimed at solving complex technical problems in emerging technologies like 5G, AI, Human Computer Interaction and Autonomous Driving. With ongoing research initiatives with 10 Universities across Canada and strategic collaboration agreements with several Universities, we support Canada's rich research community. In 2020, Huawei Canada ranked among the Top 20 corporate R&D investors in the country with a huge 40% increase in R&D investment year over year. Huawei Canada was established in 2008 and now has a total workforce of 1,200 in our six research centers across Canada.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
About Boomerang
At Boomerang, we're on a mission to revolutionize how employers stay connected with their former colleagues. We believe relationships matter and are here to provide a simple, affordable, and automated solution that keeps those connections alive.

We are a seed-stage company (~ $5M in venture capital from Tier 1 funds) that has assembled some of the best builders, designers, and product minds to reimagine the future of work.

We're seeking a Software Engineering Associate to join our Toronto office. This is an opportunity to join us on the ground floor, working alongside seasoned founders with a track record of successful companies. As a pivotal member of our growing team, you'll have the chance to make a significant impact and contribute to our collective vision.

Our Values
We believe values aren't just a top-down process but a collective effort. Our values: integrity, balance, growth, and results, guide us in decision-making and shape our behavior. We speak our truth, keep our promises, and trust each other. We embrace failure, curiosity, and continuous improvement. We ask questions without fear of judgment. We value harmony within ourselves, our team, and our community because we understand that it leads to better results. We look at outcomes over outputs and enjoy working hard (and having fun) together.

How We Work
At Boomerang, we are here to learn and become better leaders, managers, and people. You are encouraged to spend 80% of your time on core projects and 20% on innovation activities that pique your interests (including things outside of work). We enforce no meeting Fridays to allow time for these projects.

PLEASE NOTE: Boomerang uses Deel Canada strictly for payroll purposes as we are an organization incorporated in the US. You are being employed by Boomerang, not Deel.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
HAVEN - A SONY/PLAYSTATION STUDIO

In May 2021, we embarked on a journey to start Haven Studios with a small team and big ambitions. Our goal was to build a studio where we could make the kind of games we've always wanted to create - and games we've longed to play.

We've made amazing progress in a short time thanks to our talented, passionate team and their exceptional contributions. We established a culture at Haven grounded in kindness, adaptability and courage that unlocks creativity. Our first new IP for PlayStation is on track to deliver a AAA multiplayer experience with a vision to build a systemic and evolving world focused on freedom, thrill, and playfulness that will keep players entertained and engaged for years.

Haven joined the PlayStation Studios family in 2022, and we are on track to build an exclusive new IP for PlayStation and grow the first Sony game development team in Canada.

We are looking for a Tools Programmer Intern to join our Tools Team dedicated to asset pipelines and game creation workflows. You will gain exposure to a wide variety of tools involved in game creation such as Unreal, Blender and others, and collaborate with artists, animators, technical artists, and programmers to develop and improve production workflows.

In this role, your duties and responsibilities will include:

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
You're co-op work term at LEA
You will work on a variety of transportation projects providing you with hands-on experience and a deeper understanding of the different perspectives that contribute to transportation planning in our communities. You will collaborate with a team of Transportation professionals from one or more of the different pillars of LEA's Transportation Practice Area, primarily the Policy Planning pillar, and you will also get exposure to the other Transportation pillars such as Data Analytics, Intelligent Transportation and Security Systems, Design, and Project Management.

Why join LEA?
LEA is an employee-owned engineering consulting firm, with a history of 70 years. We provide engineering consulting services in the areas of Transportation, Civil, Structural/Buildings, Intelligent Transportation Systems, Environmental Management and Construction Administration.

We have a history of delivering high-quality, widely known projects in the Transportation Practice Area, including Transportation Planning, Traffic Engineering, Transportation Design, Intelligent Transportation Systems and Infrastructure Security Systems.

At LEA, we strive towards a common goal, which is self-realization and achieving the highest possible results. The company is owned by its employees and every effort counts.
Join LEA and discover your potential, because LEA:
  • Recruits high-performing, motivated individuals who strive to achieve the highest level of technical excellence and quality.
  • Is an Employee-owned company and almost half of our employees are shareholders.
  • Offers a competitive total compensation package of salary, substantial bonuses, benefits and other perks.
  • Is continuously involved in many exciting and challenging projects throughout Ontario and around the world.
  • Allows for a collaborative hybrid work environment with flexible hours to maintain a healthy work-life balance.
  • Organizes regular social events such as golf day, canoeing and camping trips, skiing, bowling, treetop trekking, board games, baseball and hockey games, volleyball and softball leagues, and other charitable events.
  • Hosts an extravagant overnight holiday party in Muskoka annually.
  • Is an organization that is committed to achieving our Environmental, Social, & Governance objectives through our various committees.
  • Prioritizes mentorship, training, and rotational assignments for knowledge advancement and career growth.
  • Has an entrepreneurial spirit as an employee-owned company, with continuous growth and expansion taking part in meaningful projects.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
At High Q, we are on a mission to redefine the standard in protein structure determination, the future of drug discovery, and the development of novel therapeutics. Join the Quantum Revolution!

About High Q Technologies
Think Quantum. High Q Technologies is a fast-growing company that develops quantum-enabled scientific instruments for ultra-high sensitivity biophysical and chemical analysis. By applying modern microwave quantum optics techniques to electron paramagnetic resonance (EPR) spectroscopy, High Q is on a mission to redefine the standard in protein structure determination, the future of drug discovery, and the development of novel therapeutics. Built upon over a decade of research and development, our patented technologies are derived from advances in experimental quantum computing, utilizing inventions created in collaboration with Professor David Cory's research group at the University of Waterloo. High Q is backed by Quantum Valley Investments and Blackberry co-founders Mike Lazaridis and Doug Fregin. The company is headquartered in Waterloo, ON.

Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:
You'll be working primarily with two of our back end developers (incidentally UW Alumni: SYDE '14 and Mathematics '19) to maintain and develop the back end service that runs Ground News under the hood. The tech stack is primarily TypeScript-based, running on Node with Express JS. MySQL is used for our databasing needs. Some of the other key technologies you'll be using include ElasticSearch, Redis, and possibly Terraform.

Every day, the dev team gets together for a video call standup to go over recently completed tasks, discuss what's next and get input on any team-wide decisions. On Fridays, the call is extended to include the non-technical team members as well to get a bigger picture overview of the company's workings.

Job responsibilities will primarily include feature planning and development, as well as bug fixing in the back-end service environment. Depending on your particular skill set, other suitable responsibilities may also be available.
Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Snapwise Inc is the team behind Ground News. Ground is a powerful news aggregator and curator. We use automated and manual processes to identify and combine articles on the web that are talking about the same news story. We put these sources side by side to let you see how all sides are covering it by annotating each source with metadata such as bias reviews, factuality reviews as well as ownership information. We have topped Product Hunt (and done well a few other times), we're frequently featured in the Apple App Store and our site has even been retweeted by the POTUS.

Your position, should you choose to accept it, will be that of a back end service developer. Our development team is fairly small, so you will represent a significant portion of the developing power behind the product. Your ideas and work will quickly and frequently become part of the product being used by thousands around the world.

Co-founded by a former NASA engineer and Bain consultant, a position with Ground News provides an unparalleled learning experience both personally and professionally. At Ground, we prioritize growth: both for our business and team members. You'll have the freedom to work remotely and play a key role in the development of Ground News products.

This is an opportunity to work with a growing and mighty team that is fighting every day to build a world where cooperative, civil debate is the norm, media is accountable, and critical thought is the baseline of our information consumption. Ground is based in Kitchener, Ontario, Canada, but this role is remote.

Ground news takes pride in being a harassment- and discrimination-free space for everyone, regardless of age, disability, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, nationality, neurotype, personal appearance, political affiliation, professional background, race, religion, or sexual identity or orientation. Our culture is one of collaboration, creativity, and diverse perspectives. We are committed to building and fostering an inclusive, accessible environment for everyone. If you have any questions, concerns, or requests regarding accessibility needs, please contact talent@ground.news, and a member of our team will be happy to help.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
An opportunity exists in the C5ISR group for a creative software developer who has a passion to invent, design, implement and test embedded software along with a curiosity and desire to learn.

As a member of this team, you will have an opportunity to participate in the development of Firmware, Board Support Packages (BSPs), device drivers for Wind River's VxWorks real time operating system, Linux, Fastpath-based network switches and automated test of our software using state of the art tools in both Linux and Windows development environments.

The developed software is for use on our single board computers, graphics and video capture modules, switch and security products based on industry standards such as CompactPCI, VMEbus and VITA46 (VPX). These products feature high performance embedded processors (Intel, ARM, PowerPC, graphics processors from AMD/ATI and Broadcom communications processors), Ethernet, USB and serial communication interconnected using high speed parallel and serial bus technologies such as PCI Express.

You will be part of the product development team, including hardware, mechanical and test engineers, engaged in the design, integration and testing of our next generation products - some in development and others in the sustaining phase. There will be ample exposure to all aspects of the software development process from requirements definition to release in an AS9100 certified environment.

Curtiss-Wright Defense Solutions is a long-established technology leader in the development of rugged electronic modules and systems for defense applications. Curtiss-Wright serves as a technology and integration partner to its customers, providing a full range of advanced, highly engineered solutions from modular open systems approaches to fully custom optimized solutions. Our unmatched capabilities and product breadth span from industry standard based COTS modules to complete electronic subsystems. The company's modules and systems are currently deployed in a wide range of demanding defense and aerospace applications including C5ISR systems, unmanned subsystems, mission computing, fire control, turret stabilization, and recording and storage solutions. Additionally, the company's broad engineering capabilities combine systems, software, electrical, and mechanical design expertise with comprehensive program management and a broad range of life-cycle support services.

If you require accommodation due to a disability at any time during the recruitment and/or assessment process, please contact Human Resources and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

This position may require exposure to information that is subject to US export control regulations such as the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). All applicants must meet eligibility requirements of the ITAR and of the Controlled Goods Directorate (CGD).

To learn more about work at Curtiss-Wright, visit https://www.curtisswrightds.com

Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:
About the role
Now, we're looking for a Product Design Co-op/Intern who's ready to make an impact, build beautiful, functional experiences, and shape the future of procurement technology.

What You'll Do
  • Design Meaningful Products → Craft elegant, user-centric interfaces that make data-heavy procurement workflows intuitive and engaging.
  • Wireframing & Prototyping → Design wireframes, user flows, and in Figma (or your preferred tool) to quickly test and iterate ideas.
  • User Research & Testing → Conduct user interviews, usability testing, and analyze pain points to refine design decisions.
  • Competitive & Market Analysis → Research industry trends, competitor UX strategies, and emerging best practices to keep NationGraph ahead of the curve.
  • Turn Complex Data into Beautiful UX → Design systems that help users visualize and navigate procurement data effortlessly.
  • Work with Engineering & Product → Collaborate closely with engineers and PMs to bring designs to life, ensuring smooth implementation and iteration.
  • Push Boundaries → Stay up-to-date with the latest in UX/UI trends, AI-driven design, and workflow automation.
Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
About NationGraph
At NationGraph, we believe in a more efficient market for government contracting. Navigating the world of government procurement is a complex task involving data aggregation, rules and regulation, regional complexities, RFI/RFQ/RFP monitoring, and budget cycles and constraints amongst many others.

We believe better software enables businesses to become more effective in seeking and reaching out to the decision makers. More effective in staying compliant with complex rules and regulations. Better at navigating and forecasting the various funding cycles within different layers of government.
Our mission is to simplify the complicated process of doing business with the government by building great software to solve a real problem.

You will be joining a small founding team that:
Has successfully built, scaled and sold companies in the past.
Built infrastructure that processed billions of dollars.
Backed by world-class VCs and operating partners that have invested and built iconic companies

What You'll Get from Us
High-Impact Work → See your designs shipped and used in the real world.
Mentorship from Industry Experts → Work directly with experienced designers, founders, and engineers.
Hands-on Learning → This isn't a "shadowing" internship-you'll be designing, iterating, and shipping!
Competitive Compensation → Because great work deserves great pay.
Toronto/Vancouver Preferred, Remote Considered → We value in-person collaboration but are open to great candidates anywhere.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills:
What You'll Need

A Portfolio → Show us your work! (Links required-applications without a portfolio will not be considered.) Please link it either in your Resume, or throughout the application.

Strong UX/UI Skills → You can turn complex workflows into simple, beautiful, and usable experiences.

Wireframing & Workflow Design → Experience with user flows, wireframing, and interaction design.
User Research & Competitive Analysis → Ability to gather insights, analyze competitors, and iterate based on real data.
Figma Proficiency → You know your way around auto-layout, components, and how to use styles/variables.
A Passion for Data & Design → Experience with data-heavy dashboards, SaaS tools, or workflow automation is a plus!
Some Frontend Knowledge (Optional) → Basic HTML/CSS/React understanding is a bonus, but not required.
Curiosity & Hustle → You're eager to learn, iterate quickly, and push yourself to design at a world-class level.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
What we're tackling
Rundoo exists to improve the marketplace for building materials. There are ~$1,000,000,000,000 of building materials bought every year in the US (a full 5% of US GDP is just transacting materials!), and the vast majority of these transactions happen over the phone or in-person and then live in 40-year-old point-of-sale (POS) systems. We aim to bring all these transactions online, thereby making it safer and more efficient to build.

Who we are
We are currently 17 people & 3 dogs. In alphabetical order:
  • Amanda (Recruiting & Growth); studied marketing in De La Salle University; worked in recruiting at a few startups; loves hiking and diving!
  • Andrew (CTO): studied computer science & humanities at Stanford; worked as a software engineer and head of engineering at Apple & Anova; danced with the SF ballet (where he met his wife)!
  • Gemma (Andrew's puppy): woof arf woof woof bark; in the office most days!
  • Clara (Growth): studied Literature at University College London; worked in gtm strategy for a feminine health tech startup in Paris and then came to the bay to work in sales for Verkada; am often seen doing a headstand
  • Emmie (SWE): studied math & computer science at Stanford; worked as a software engineer at Flexport; loves confetti cake and almond croissants
  • George (SWE): studied computer science at Stanford; worked as a software engineer at Facebook; exclusively reacts on Slack with the shaka!
  • Joe (Growth): studied math & computer science at Stanford; worked as a consultant at Bain & Company; has been pulled over for speeding on a bicycle but never in a car
  • Matt (Growth): studied history at Northwestern; taught middle school in Chicago (hardest job ever), more recently worked in sales and general management at a fishing tackle company (Catch Co.); former competitive angler in college (bass fishing)
  • Max (Growth): studied neuro at Dartmouth; worked as a consultant at Bain & Company and as a PM for RabbitHole; has broken his neck exactly one time (and coincidentally has tried parkour exactly one time)
  • Nahom (SWE): studied neuroscience & computer science at MIT; worked on Ads for Amazon Music; self-proclaimed music historian
  • Brodie (Nahom's puppy): *muffled paper ripping*; in the office everyday!
  • Nesh (SWE): studied electrical engineering at Kenyatta university; worked as a SWE at a variety of startups; big SpongeBob guy!
  • Nick (CEO): studied math & computer science at Stanford; worked as a trader at Bridgewater & Citadel and as a PM at Google & Enigma; distantly related to the founder of the Hershey company!
  • YB (Nick's dog): ... (he doesn't bark much lol); in the office everyday!
  • Santiago (SWE): studying computer engineering at University of Waterloo; worked as SWE intern at The Cooperators, Inflight, BitBakery, Replicant; played lots of soccer, loves rap and r&b
  • Shalon (SWE): studied Computer Science at Jomo Kenyatta University of Agriculture and Technology; worked as a SWE at various startups; Rick & Morty enthusiast!
  • Shloka (SWE): studied Integrative Biology at UC Berkeley (Gooo Bears); worked as an EMT and a teacher for a CS bootcamp; likes to write poetry and play chess!
  • Tyler (Tech Support & Growth): studied general education and tech at Cabrillo College; worked as a system administrator for a short time and at a paint store (Kings paint!!!) for eight years, manager for two; likes to play most video games, currently playing Diablo 4.
  • Umer (SWE): studying computer science at National University of Singapore; worked as a SWE intern at Visa and an NLP chatbot startup back in Singapore; has an identical twin!
  • Zach (Design): studied product design at Stanford; worked in design at a few startups; currently wearing socks with cocktails on them!
What we stand for
The values we hold most dear are learning and growth through candid feedback and frequent experimentation, enjoying our time together, truly empathizing with clients (we've worked at paint stores & lumber yards!), building a diverse team, and hustling to achieve great things as fast as we can.

About the Internship Program
The ideal summer intern is passionate about making the Internet a better place. You will work with strong engineers. You will push code this summer that touches hundreds of millions of web surfers. We like to get things done, so we are looking for interns who are curious and can take on and complete projects. This is a great opportunity for engineers that want to learn to develop at Internet scale.

What would you do as a Cloudflare intern?
Ship and deliver projects over 12-16 weeks with autonomy and support.
Work cross-functionally with various teams.
Be assigned a mentor to guide you through the internship and help with career goals.
Build your network across the company through our various in and out of office socials, networking programs, Employee Resource Group (ERG) programs, and Activity Groups (Cat or dog lovers, we've got communities for you! @Catflare @Doggos).
Present your project to the entire company at the end of the internship.
Get direct access to our executives and leadership team including our co-founders.
Learn and develop skills through our professional development workshops.
Write for our Cloudflare blog and be featured on Cloudflare.tv sessions.
Receive Cloudflare swag and free Cloudflare products!
You can check out our internship blogs to learn more about our program and hear directly from our past interns.
Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
About Us
At Cloudflare, we are on a mission to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world's largest networks that powers millions of websites and other Internet properties for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine's Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World's Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.
We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!

About Cloudflare's Engineering teams
Anytime we push code, it automatically affects the millions of Internet properties (powering websites, remote teams, APIs, mobile apps, etc.) running on our global network. Cloudflare's network is one of the largest in the world and spans over 300 cities in more than 100 countries. What's more, Cloudflare operates within 50 milliseconds of 95% of the Internet-connected population globally (for context, the blink of an eye is 300-400 milliseconds!). We are passionate about making the Internet more secure, reliable, and faster for everyone.
Cloudflare's Engineering teams build and run the software that handles the massive amount of traffic that flows through our network. We also have teams that build the UI and control plane for our software, using modern patterns and libraries in a microservices-based architecture. Technologies include: C/C++, Rust, Go, Python, Typescript, JavaScript and ReactJS.

Demonstrated critical thinking skills and drive to learn and adapt new technologies.
Curiosity, empathy and ability to get things done.
Ability to commit to a 12 week summer internship.
In office 3 days a week in Austin, TX.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Are you interested in defining how Generative AI will shape the future of work?

We are a Silicon Valley Series D startup, spun out of the Stanford AI lab and are co-founded by Sebastian Thrun, co-founder and CEO of Google-X, Waymo, Udacity, Kitty Hawk, and more. Cresta launched in 2020. Since then, we've grown revenue and our team by 300% and became officially a Unicorn. We've assembled a world-class team of AI and ML experts, go-to-market leaders, top-tier investors, and advisors including Andreessen Horowitz, Greylock Partners, Sequoia Capital, Tiger Global, and former AT&T CEO John Donovan. Our valued customers include brands like Intuit, Porsche, Holiday Inn, and Dropbox and we have been recognized as a startup to watch by Business Insider, Forbes, and Gartner to name a few.

We are growing our machine learning team in North America. Join us to develop great products in an exceptional strong team.

Cresta is on a mission to make every knowledge worker 100x as effective, 10x faster, and 10x better. We apply AI to improve Call Center operations using our patented real-time coaching platform. We provide dynamic, live guidance to every agent based on the best practices of the top performers.

About Your Role
As a full-stack software engineer, you will have the options to work on different products at Cresta. Cresta Opera, the no-code AI command center for contact centers. Cresta Platform, the core engineering platform that enables all Cresta features. Cresta Studio, the one-stop-shop for call analysis, building, evaluating, and deploying conversational AI models. The products leverage the latest LLM technologies to build differentiated product suites.

You will join a collaborative but highly autonomous working environment in which each member has a defined role with clear expectations, as well as the freedom to pursue individual projects.

  • Comfortable defining and building robust APIs with a strong understanding for different protocols like REST, RPC frameworks, Websockets etc.
  • Experience with database schema design and an understanding of query performance that translates to performant, scalable, and reactive products.

We are Nest Wallet, a rapidly growing crypto company focused on building the ultimate on-chain trading app. Our wallet is designed to provide a fast, seamless, and secure trading experience across multiple blockchains, using advanced technologies like smart contracts and account abstraction (AA). Nest Wallet is available as a browser extension, iOS, and Android app (check us out at nestwallet.xyz).

Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:
Duties
As a Quantitative Trading Intern, you will have the opportunity to work closely with Hermetik's founder in developing cutting edge investment strategies, new data pipelines, and trade execution software. You will be supported by the founder and other team members including machine learning experts in successfully achieving your project goals. There will be room for new ideas in your role, building on existing strategies and data pipelines while giving wide responsibility in developing and implementing your own ideas and discoveries. This role will be directly involved in the day-to-day trading operations of Hermetik and will provide invaluable experience in the world of quantitative finance, digital assets, and decentralized finance.

Responsibilities include
  • Applying statistical models and/or machine learning to existing data pipelines to explore and develop new algorithmic trading strategies
  • Back testing & optimizing existing algorithmic trading strategies
  • Expanding data pipelines for higher data volumes as well as designing new data pipelines across various decentralized finance protocols and blockchains
  • Contributing to trade execution systems for live testing and deployment of algorithmic trading strategies
  • Work with various blockchain data sources including APIs and RPC nodes for collecting, parsing, and analyzing financial and trade data
  • Contribute to portfolio tracking & optimization tools
Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
About Us
Hermetik is a digital asset investment startup developing investment products in the nascent market of decentralized finance. Hermetik utilizes cutting edge blockchain data and proprietary algorithms to drive investment decisions and generate high, uncorrelated returns for investors. We are a team of deep crypto experts having spent a decade researching and investing in digital asset markets building a quantitative investment fund at the forefront of finance.

The applicant should be pursuing a Bachelor of Computer Science degree with a minimum of 2 years completed OR have demonstrated experience in the above areas and have completed 2 years of a bachelor's degree.

We are seeking a highly motivated individual with a passion for statistical analysis, crypto, and/or algorithmic trading.

Required Competencies
  • Experience in algorithm development & testing
  • Experience in working with real-time APIs and data streams
  • Understanding of capital markets, market microstructure, and/or crypto markets
  • Strong skills in statistical modeling and back testing frameworks
  • Strong programming skills in Python, C++, and SQL
  • Programming skills in Solidity, Rust, or other blockchain-native languages are an asset
  • Experience in artificial intelligence / machine learning is an asset
  • Passion for crypto, decentralized finance, and blockchain markets
Work Term Outcomes:
  • Develop a deep understanding of the forefront of digital assets and decentralized finance
  • Develop algorithmic and statistical trading experience in a quantitative hedge fund
  • Develop strong skills in algorithm development, testing and deployment
  • Develop an understanding of blockchain data structures and pipelines
  • Potential for full-time opportunities after graduation

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
About Tensor
Tensor Labs is building the future of internet finance. We've done over $2bn in volume, given back over $400m to our community, and serve nearly 1m traders every month.

Our first product, Tensor, is Solana's largest NFT marketplace.
Our new product, Vector, is a mobile app that will change trading forever.

We're backed by Placeholder, Solana Ventures, Alliance, Anatoly Yakovenko and Raj Gokal (co-founders of Solana).

We're also profitable! (not very common for seed startups)

About the Role
You'll be at the ground floor of scaling Vector, our new mobile app, for the next 10 million traders and building the most sophisticated trading infrastructure & platform for digital assets in the world. You will be working remotely for our NSF office.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills:
You are:
  • Excited about web3/crypto. We really cannot overstate this - you'll be joining a team of web3 nerds
  • A generalist who like working on large-scale, data-intensive apps
  • Experienced with React, NodeJS, Postgres, Redis and Docker (if you have experience with other modern stacks that's totally fine too, as long as you're a fast learner!)
  • Proficient in at least one low-level language (ideally Rust or Go)
  • High ownership: unafraid to take on more responsibility and work hard
Bonus points for:
  • Experience scaling data-rich consumer products, APIs & trading infrastructure to millions of users and O(terabytes) data
  • Experience building real-time pipelines on AWS (Kinesis, Dynamo, SQS, RDS) and services on Kubernetes
  • Experience optimizing React apps to handle hundreds of renders per minute
  • Experience writing smart contracts (Solidity, Solana, or Move)
  • Strong fundamentals in statistics, math, or quantitative finance
  • Good intuition on when to move fast/break things vs when to move carefully

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Full-Stack Developer - University Co-Op Student

We like to call Signiant one of Ottawa's best-kept secrets in the technology sector!

You already know our customers. They are brand-name, internationally recognized leaders in media and entertainment, including:
- TV Broadcast: A+E, BBC, Discovery, Fox, NBC
- Web, Mobile & OTT: Apple iTunes, Rogers Anyplace TV, Netflix
- Studios & Production: 20th Century Fox, Disney, Marvel, NBC Universal
- Media Services: BT Media & Broadcast, Deluxe Digital Studios, Technicolor
- Sports: ESPN, NBC Olympics, NFL Network, NHL
- Game Publishing: Electronic Arts, Ubisoft, Xbox

Used today by more of the world's top broadcasters, studios, media service providers, sports networks and game developers, Signiant delivers intelligent software solutions that facilitate the movement of file-based media between systems, applications and users from pre-production content and mobile news to finished-format movies, trailers and TV episodics. And with the acquisition of two companies in 2021, Signiant has moved well beyond fast file transfer. Headquartered in the U.S with offices and partners worldwide, Signiant is the company with the technology, people and industry experience trusted for fast, secure and managed media movement.

Signiant is growing, and we need motivated, innovative and passionate co-op students who want to play a significant role in building a better Signiant.

Signiant provides mission-critical products to leading companies in the Media and Entertainment industry. We are looking for a co-op student who would be focused on Agile story work within a full-stack development team, primarily developing in Javascript (Node) and React.

You aren't given special "student" tasks here at Signiant - you'll be working on SaaS features and functionality that will be put into production for use by some of the biggest names in the Media and Entertainment industry. You'll work in a fast-paced, modern, agile development environment where we use the latest tools and technology, including software from the biggest cloud vendors in the industry.

Signiant
Used today by more of the world's top broadcasters, studios, media service providers, sports networks, and game developers, Signiant delivers intelligent software solutions that facilitate the movement of file-based media between systems, applications, and users from pre-production content and mobile news to finished-format movies, trailers, and TV episodics.

Headquartered in the U.S. with offices and partners worldwide, Signiant is the company with the technology, people, and industry experience trusted for fast, secure, and managed media movement.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Yuen Lab (https://lab.research.sickkids.ca/yuen/) is looking for a highly motivated Co-op Software Developer to contribute to the development of cutting-edge tools for genetic variant detection from genome sequencing data. This role provides hands-on experience in bioinformatics software development, working with real-world genomic datasets.

The Software Engineer will be a member of Yuen Lab that studies the genetics and epigenetics of complex disorders. We are interested in understanding how genetic and epigenetic variations contribute to human health, with a focus on neurodevelopmental and neurological disorders. Utilizing (epi)genomic technologies, we aim to develop novel disease gene discovery strategies, effective diagnostic approaches, and better treatments for the disorders. Our current research includes: gene identification, tool development, variant characterization, tandem repeats, and genetic modifiers.

The primary responsibility will be developing software for detecting genetic variants from long-read genome sequencing data.

The Software Engineer will be working with graduate students and other Bioinformaticians in the lab. They will also have the opportunity to interact and collaborate with researchers and clinicians from SickKids, and other collaborated bioinformatic company.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills:
• Proficiency in at least one scripting language (Python, C++, etc.) is essential.
  • Experience with long-read sequencing technologies (e.g., PacBio, Oxford Nanopore) is considered an asset.
  • Knowledge in algorithms for sequence alignment, assembly, and variant calling is considered an asset.
  • Experience in analyzing genomic data is considered an asset.
  • Familiarity with HPC environments and how to run applications in HPC clusters is desirable.
  • Excellent organizational and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
  • Highly motivated and willingness to learn.
  • Excellent attention to detail.
  • Exceptional communication skills; both oral and written.
Job Posting Information.Special Job Requirements: This a software development position on a Cloud-based genome data sharing platform for whole genome sequencing sharing and analysis. High proficiency (and ideally past experience) in at least one scripting language (Python, Perl, etc.) is a MUST to be considered for this position.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
4 month work term

What We Do
We help life sciences companies run smaller, faster, and more successful clinical trials using our computational imaging software platform.

About Altis Labs
Altis Labs is the computational imaging company advancing precision medicine. We believe that medical imaging is the richest source of untapped information. Life sciences companies use our AI-powered software platform, Nota, to de-risk and accelerate all stages of clinical development. Trained on over 140 million longitudinal real-world images with associated clinical information, our deep learning models predict clinically meaningful outcomes to quantify treatment effect more accurately. Legacy data interpretation methods have led to slow, risky, and expensive drug development requiring more than $2 billion and 10 years to get a new treatment to market.

Our diverse team of data scientists, engineers, clinicians, and business operators is on a mission to help get the most effective treatment to patients sooner. We collaborate closely with leading clinician scientists at academic medical centers and co-publish our work in top-tier medical journals.

Altis was founded in Toronto in 2019 and bootstrapped for three years thanks to early customer traction. We just closed our seed round (yet to be formally announced). Now, with 3+ years of runway, we are looking to expand our team with key positions in engineering, data science, marketing, and other roles to help us transform clinical research.

About the Position
Altis Labs is recruiting an experienced full-stack web engineer with an entrepreneurial and product-focused mindset. The successful candidate will play a critical role in designing and building tools to:
  • Enable data upload, management, and controlled access
  • Collect human-generated annotations
  • Deploy deep learning algorithms that automatically generate labels from images
  • Visualize algorithm results
The candidate will be responsible for helping to produce high quality, well-tested and user-friendly software. We expect responsibilities will be dynamic and expand as we strive to meet our clients' needs. As part of our founding technical team, you will play a key role in designing and developing our products.
This is a full-time position with the option of working remotely or on a hybrid basis at our office in Toronto. We expect responsibilities will be dynamic and expand as we strive to meet our team's and clients' needs.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills:
Qualifications:
  • Strong interest in all aspects of web development engineering experience in a production environment
  • Past experience with front-end frameworks (e.g. ReactJS/Angular/Vue/etc.)
  • Past experience with back-end frameworks (e.g. Node, GraphQL, Express, Flask, PostgreSQL, etc.) is beneficial
  • Understanding of the software development life cycle for web applications using software development tools and methods (source control, unit testing, bug tracking, continuous integration, etc.) is beneficial
  • High attention to detail and problem-solving aptitude
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
Nice to have:
  • Experience in cloud environments AWS/GCP/Azure, etc.
  • Past experience in the medical technology domain

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
About Miovision: At Miovision, our mission is to revolutionize transportation. We enable cities to reduce traffic congestion and vehicle emissions while improving public safety through scalable intelligent transportation solutions.

Our AI-powered platform helps improve traffic efficiency at the intersection and makes roads safer for all types of road users - drivers, cyclists, pedestrians, transit riders and emergency responders. Together, Miovision's permanent and portable systems have detected more than 77 billion vehicles and 3 billion pedestrians and cyclists, providing accurate, actionable traffic data and insights that help make transportation safer and more efficient for all.

As a co-op student at Miovision, you'll work on real projects, solve real problems, and gain feedback along the way from experts in your field. We provide the tools and mentorship you need, and trust you to take ownership over your success. You are part of the team; working alongside brilliant minds to push the boundaries of traffic technology, and directly impact cities all over the world.

Join us while we continue our journey of inspiring customers by empowering them with the innovative tools they need to build healthier communities, safer roads, and to help reduce congestion and keep moving.

Let's move!

Miovision is headquartered in Kitchener, Canada, and has offices in Germany, Serbia, and the US. Since its start in 2005, Miovision has served nearly 2,000 customers in 63 countries. For more information, visit miovision.com.

Top Reasons to Work with Us
  • We're builders, entrepreneurs and collaborators who value diverse thinking and backgrounds.
  • If you enjoy cutting-edge technology and architecting solutions to real world problems such as traffic congestion, carbon footprint reduction, pedestrian safety & public infrastructure enablement; then you'll love working on our team.
  • We offer Training and Development Programs as well as mentorship from A-Players in the industry
  • Learn and develop your skills whether you are with us as a co-op student, part-time employee or full-time worker
Miovision is looking for an exceptional Firmware Developer who is passionate about solving complex problems. In this role, you will have the freedom and responsibility to collaborate, design, and develop embedded firmware on Miovision hardware and test systems.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Scispot.io is a no code digital operating platform for life science companies. Our mission is to scale and grow a biotech company the way a tech company does. Our co-founders bring a rich blend of Biotech expertise, Product lifecycle and growth expertise and of course Silicon Valley Tech expertise. We are super passionate about what we do and what we're trying to build at this company. Scispot.io is backed by prominent startup accelerators such as MaRS Discovery District and YCombinator.

We are looking for a Product Designer to build the user experience and interface never seen before in the life science industry. You'll be directly reporting to the Chief Product Officer of the company and own the end to end design life cycle for a fast growing lifescience tech company.

Our customers are brilliant scientist and researchers who bring life saving drugs to market or grow protein in lab! This decade will see the Amazon, Google, and Microsoft of bio. This is your chance to come and make an impact. Build world class UX and UI for people who matter to this planet.

As a Product Designer, you should be comfortable with Figma or any other interface design tools. Along with designing UI and improving the UX, if you know javascript or react, that would be a plus! You should also be a team player with a knack for visual design and utility. Given that we are still a startup, we are looking for self-starters and self-motivated candidates who not only possess the technical abilities necessary for the role, but also are able to think big picture and long-term.

You will not only grow your design skill but will also learn a cutting edge front and back end in this co-op.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
CRM Developer Co-op - Spring 2025

Company Overview:
Ontario One Call acts as the communications link between buried infrastructure owners (our members) and individuals who are planning to dig in the province of Ontario. In 2012, the Ontario Underground Infrastructure Notification System Act was passed, which stipulates that by law, anyone in the province of Ontario must contact Ontario One Call before they dig. In addition to our contact centre, we are also responsible for public education, industry outreach, and compliance.

As a Public Safety Authority, Ontario One Call is focused on guiding construction, infrastructure and excavation industries towards creating efficiencies and improvements across the province. Ontario One Call is a not-for-profit governed by a Board of Directors representative of the underground infrastructure and excavation industries.

Core Values:
Caring…We invest in the success and safety for our team, communities and the environment.
Integrity...We are dedicated, honourable and honest.
Collaborative...We foster partnerships and work together to build a safer Ontario.
Inclusive...We are a leader in inclusivity and cultivate a foundation of respect and support within our industry.
Innovative...We strive for excellence with a willingness to learn, adapt and innovate.
Do you have what it takes to join our team?

Position Overview:
Reporting to the Director of Platform Engineering, the CRM Developer will contribute to a team to research and develop a customer relationship management solution that aims to modernize components of an existing business flow. This position will require a strong understanding of web application technologies built using C# .NET which includes API integrations and the opportunity to work with Power Apps to develop business solutions unique to our industry. The candidate will help plan, design, implement, deploy, and test solutions in a modular approach to building integrated components of a CRM application.
This position is located at the Guelph office at 104 Cooper Drive, Guelph, ON. Ontario One Call has a hybrid work model with staff dividing their workweek between in-office and at-home work per company policy.

Primary Responsibilities:
  • Contribute to planning and execution of cloud migration projects deployed to Azure.
  • Design and implement CRM workflows and integrations using Dynamics 365 Customer Service
  • Develop solutions to support an API interface
  • Identify defects and implement fixes
  • Facilitate Data Migrations using automated procedures to transform legacy tables into modern CRM data
  • Provide well written documentation in the form of ReadMe's, Design Documents, or Getting Started guides
Key Deliverables:
  • Quality implementation of CRM workflows
  • Functional solutions verified in Sandbox environments before promoting to production environments
Qualifications:
  • Ability to adapt quickly to changing priorities and influence others without authority.
  • Outcomes-focused mindset.
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, including presentation and facilitation skills.
  • Experience and Proficiency in programming would be advantageous to solving problems
Technical Requirements:
  • Experience in Microsoft Azure cloud, Microsoft Azure AD B2C, and Microsoft Dynamics 365
  • Experience with Microsoft suite of software applications, including SharePoint, Power BI, Azure App Services, and Azure SQL Databases.
  • Capable of building upon working solutions, learning new technologies, and applying changes to improve the working model
  • Architecting the best solution from adequate planning with team members, with a mindset of evaluating all considerations before arriving to a design decision.
Agile and DevOps Practices:
  • Understanding of Agile methodologies and frameworks (Scrum, Kanban).
Education & Experience:
  • 1-2 years of experience as a CRM Developer or Web Application Developer
  • Minimum of 2 years in software development
  • Experience with microservices would be nice to have
  • Experience with configuration of cloud platforms, including Azure would be nice to have

Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:
What you'll get out of working at D2L

You'll be given challenges, responsibilities, opportunities to learn new things, and meaningful enhancements on a product that reaches over 15 million learners daily - these are just a few of the things that set D2L apart as a student employer and have earned D2L a number of recent UBC Science Coop Employer and Supervisor awards.

At D2L, you will have the opportunity to work with the latest technologies to build highly scalable and fault tolerant systems. On the backend, our product is built on the .NET stack, but we have a growing ecosystem of cloud-native services built on the AWS platform leveraging technologies such as Node.js, SNS, SQS, Kinesis, DynamoDB, Serverless (Lambda), etc. On the front-end we use LitElement and other web frameworks to build engaging and responsive web apps. We also build native mobile apps in Kotlin and Swift. Ultimately, we strive to use the most appropriate technologies to achieve our goal of changing the way the world learns. You don't need to know how to use these yet, we'll help you learn - your work term will begin with structured training, then you'll have a mentor and number of supportive teammates to help you learn as you go.
Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Every day, our software is used by millions of people around the world, and we are looking for students who share in our excitement and passion for transforming the way the world learns. At D2L, we believe that learning should be accessible and engaging. Our goal is to create easy, flexible, and smart software that ignites the desire to learn in everyone. To do this, we need to give talented, enthusiastic, and passionate people, like you, opportunities to create, develop, and collaborate on projects that revolutionize the learning environment.

We are looking for passionate developers to help influence and advance future versions of our Brightspace software. You'll thrive in our agile culture, where teams speak freely and collaborate to solve interesting problems, and will be constantly learning and looking for ways to innovate. If you get stuck, you can work with your assigned mentor to figure out the best way to proceed.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills:
What is D2L looking for from me?

You have a strong entrepreneurial drive, an enthusiastic and dedicated mindset and a thirst for a challenge. The ability to think on your feet and work successfully both in independent and team-settings is essential. At D2L, our co-ops have a voice and are able to quickly contribute to their team's objectives (we don't have "co-op projects", you'll be working on real deliverables).

Education Recommendations

Currently a candidate for Bachelor's degree or diploma in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a related field with the co-op option.

Compensation

At the IESO, we know that achieving great results depends on embracing diversity by attracting, developing and retaining people from a wide variety of backgrounds. We do this by ensuring our recruitment and advancement policies are fair and equitable, and by creating an accessible and inclusive environment - one that values every team member's unique skills and experiences and ensures they have the support they need to achieve their potential. Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Independent Electricity System Operator (IESO)


Due to the IESO's role in the energy sector, please note that a full security check will be conducted. Job offers will be conditional until you have successfully attained security clearance to work at the IESO.

Why join us?

You've got great skills. And you want to use them in an organization where you know what you do every day matters. We get that.

We also know that ensuring Ontarians have access to affordable and reliable power doesn't happen by accident. So we give you the tools, flexibility and support you need to achieve your goals, and development opportunities to help you grow. You'll thrive in a collaborative, team-based environment that values your unique skills and experiences - and recognizes that when you do better, we become even better too.

Who we are

The Independent Electricity System Operator (IESO) works at the centre of the province's power system, ensuring Ontarians have access to reliable and cost-effective electricity when and where they need it. We operate the province's electricity grid 24/7, design, run and oversee the wholesale electricity markets, and plan and prepare to meet Ontario's electricity needs - now and into the future.

The Opportunity

Division/Department: Information & Technology Services / Business Service & Solution Delivery Department

You will be a part of a group responsible for: Solutions Development

Discipline(s) Required: Pursuing a bachelor's degree or college diploma in Computer Science or related field.

  • Understanding of software development lifecycle.
  • Strong problem-solving skills.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Experience performing data analysis and data exploration
  • Experience with Python, SQL Programming and BI tools such as Tableau

Level: Preferably 2nd year or above

Duration: 4 or 8 months

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Revvity is looking for a Product Manager Co-op.

About us:
Imagine a world where you could detect health issues sooner to treat them more effectively, and where scientific and medical research are enhanced to solve the greatest challenges of our time. For us, we imagine this world every day. Then, we innovate and collaborate to make it happen everywhere.
Our dedicated team of over 11,000 employees worldwide, pioneer scientific technologies for better detection, imaging, and informatics to help our customers work to create healthier families, improve quality of life, and sustain the well-being and longevity of people globally. If you're seeking a meaningful, impactful, and stimulating co-op placement, look no further.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills:
Requirements:
Strong interest in artificial intelligence and its practical applications in business
Basic understanding of machine learning concepts and AI technologies
Engaging with UX designers, UX researchers, developers and stakeholders to define and document clear product requirements
Prioritizing and planning features based on company and stakeholder priorities and business values
Distilling very technical concepts to business colleagues and vice versa
Presenting information to others (e.g., to the design team/business stakeholders)
Define and track success metrics
Work with software engineering teams on bug triage and requirements
You're open to rolling up your sleeves and doing a bit of end-user research and testing as needed, to make the team and product a success
Ability to effectively communicate in both oral and written English

Some of the other things we care about:
Worked previously on an AI based product either as a PM or developer
You are able to empathize with our end-users and are interested in doing some research.
Using analytical tools and conducting product-related analyses to produce actionable insights and communicate findings
Knowledge of user-centered design methodologies
Believe that discussion, inclusivity and transparency result in better products
Are eager to learn from your team and others. We value making each other successful!
A willingness to try new things and a love of learning
You're a go-getter, with a keen desire to get things done


Using the "OCEAN" model which stands for Openness, Conscientiousness, Extraversion, Agreeableness and Neuroticism, we're looking for the following personality traits:
Openness - The ability to take on new challenges and learn new things.
Conscientiousness - The ability to work independently and deliver high-quality work.
Extraversion - The ability to communicate directly with customers and users, and to present your work clearly and effectively to different stakeholders as needed.
Agreeableness - Be kind and thoughtful. We value people who are respectful of others and who are willing to jump in and help where and when needed.
Neuroticism - Although we try and minimize stress levels, there will be deadlines to meet. Plans can change, so the ability to pivot and adapt to changing priorities will be important.

Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:
Huawei Canada has an immediate co-op opening for a Software Developer.

About the team:
The Intelligent Real-Time Operating System Lab focuses on OS architecture, concurrency challenges, and optimal resource management for diverse use cases. This lab aims to innovate operating system designs for mixed-criticality environments that exceed traditional methods. The focus of this lab is to develop a next-generation operating system platform suitable for deployment across various domains, including cars, smartphones, and ICT/IoT devices, ensuring enhanced performance and reliability in increasingly complex environments.


About the job:
Exploring the Real-Time OS research or development targeting embedded devices, cloud & virtualized computing and automotive domain.
Contribute and help build the next-generation Real-Time OS technology to power a broad range of compute platforms.
Solve some very challenging problems around scheduling, resource allocation, isolation and IPC in very complex systems.
Focus on developing tooling and solutions to performance challenges in the system.
Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
About Huawei
With 194,000 employees and operating in more than 170 countries and regions, Huawei is a leading global creator and provider of information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure and smart devices. Integrated solutions span across four key domains - telecom networks, IT, smart devices, and cloud services. Huawei is committed to bringing digital to every person, home and organization for a fully connected, intelligent world.

About Huawei Canada
Huawei Canada focuses on fundamental research and development aimed at solving complex technical problems in emerging technologies like 5G, AI, Human Computer Interaction and Autonomous Driving. With ongoing research initiatives with 10 Universities across Canada and strategic collaboration agreements with several Universities, we support Canada's rich research community. In 2020, Huawei Canada ranked among the Top 20 corporate R&D investors in the country with a huge 40% increase in R&D investment year over year. Huawei Canada was established in 2008 and now has a total workforce of 1,200 in our six research centers across Canada.

Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:
• Conduct research and development on wearable monitoring systems for construction safety and AR-based warning systems for real-time, hands-free worker feedback.
  • Process and analyze biometric and motion data to detect fatigue and hazardous activities.
  • Contribute to technical reports, research publications, and industry applications.
  • Present findings at conferences, workshops, and industry collaborations.
  • Work closely with industry partners and government stakeholders to translate research into practical applications.
Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
We are seeking engineering and technology students to contribute to an innovative project focused on enhancing health and safety in physically demanding work environments such as construction, manufacturing, logistics, and industrial operations.
Co-op students will work on practical, research-driven applications leveraging wearable sensors, motion capture systems, and ergonomic monitoring to improve workplace safety. The project aims to assess worker fatigue, detect hazardous movements, and develop real-time feedback systems to reduce the risk of musculoskeletal injuries and other workplace hazards.
This role involves working with wearable monitoring devices, motion tracking systems, and biometric sensors to analyze worker movement patterns and ergonomics. Students may also explore augmented reality (AR) or smart glasses as a hands-free feedback system for real-time safety alerts.
This is an opportunity to collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of engineers, researchers, and industry partners, contributing to cutting-edge workplace safety innovations.
Students with experience in wearable technology, motion capture, human biomechanics, or AR development are encouraged to apply.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills:
Required:
  • Currently enrolled in an undergraduate, MASc, or Ph.D. program in Civil Engineering, Computer Science, Mechatronics, Mechanical Engineering, or related fields.
  • Experience with wearable sensors, motion tracking, or biometric data analysis.
  • Proficiency in Python, C++, MATLAB, or related programming languages.
  • Strong communication skills in English (spoken and written).
Preferred:
  • Experience with motion capture systems (e.g., IMUs, optical tracking, inertial sensors).
  • Familiarity with signal processing for biomechanical data.
  • Interest in AR/VR applications for real-time feedback and safety training.
  • Understanding of ergonomics and occupational safety principles.

Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:
The successful candidate will work with a multi-disciplinary team from the NRC Construction Research Centre on an IT modernization initiative to improve planning, collaboration and content management to support teams managing the national construction codes, specifications and product evaluations. Additionally, the successful candidate will contribute to a collaborative research and development program to support the Canadian construction sector in increasing productivity and housing supply through digitalization, including the conversion of the national construction codes to a machine-readable format that is compatible with three-dimensional Building Information Models (BIM).

Your primary duties will include:

• Full-stack development on a new digital construction platform, including an external portal and staff applications/databases, utilizing Next.JS, Material.UI, .NET Core APIs and relational / NoSQL /Graph / XML databases on a Microsoft Azure cloud platform.
• Contributing to collaborative research, proof-of-concept and pilot projects related to the digitalization of building codes and process (permitting, compliance, checking, adoption of Building Information Modeling standards, etc.)
• Supporting planning activities for research and regulatory (construction codes) initiatives and programs
• Contributing to application development and/or investigative tasks for identifying potential solutions to business requirements / user stories
• Support design, development and integration of AI solutions into an in-progress digital construction platform (e.g. Azure AI studio and other cloud-based application/data/integration resources).
Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
Discover the possible

Anything is possible at the National Research Council (NRC). As Canada's leading research and technology organization, our world-renowned research pushes the boundaries of science and engineering to make the impossible, possible. Every day we explore new ideas through innovative research and help companies discover possibilities that impact Canada's future and the world.

At the NRC, you'll also discover new possibilities. Our supportive workplace fosters a culture of creativity, welcoming fresh perspectives and innovation at all levels. We value teamwork. You'll collaborate across multiple fields and with the brightest minds to find creative solutions. Most importantly, you'll discover what's possible within you as you grow, make valuable contributions and progress in your professional journey. From ground-breaking discoveries to a life-changing career, discover your possible at the NRC.

The NRC Co-op Program

The NRC Co-op Program provides practical career-related experience work terms to promising students in research and development, engineering, technology, administration, librarian science, computer science, trades, business, technology advisors, finance, human resources, and other professions. NRC, Canadian universities and colleges and cégep co-op offices jointly administer the NRC Co-op Program.

Positions are offered across NRC in various locations from coast to coast.

The Role

The successful candidate will play an important role within a team that is engaged in advancing digital construction practices in Canada, including the digitalization of construction codes, specifications and processes (e.g. permitting, compliance checking).

The effort of this team directly contributes to the multi-year research & development initiatives to enable decarbonization and digitalization of the Canadian construction sector.

Work Setting: This is a hybrid work arrangement, with an on-site presence required part of the time.

Asset:

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
At Oracle NetSuite, we build the best-in-class system for automating business processes. We help our customers run their businesses and scale with them as they grow. As a premier part of Oracle's organization, Development teams at NetSuite enjoys a start-up culture with the added benefits of the strength and stability of a global organization. Our work environment is open and agile. We thrive on collaboration and global partnership to build a seamlessly integrated suite of features and flexible solutions. We have developers and product owners in eight offices worldwide, all rallying around one common purpose - helping our customers achieve their goals. NetSuite developers do more than write code. We become specialists in our business domain and take the time to deeply understand our customers' goals. We own the design of our product, bringing questions and ideas to the table and analyzing them. We develop greenfield code for new engines as well as maintain a powerful legacy codebase.

So, you're interested in a co-op? When you join our co-op program, you will be given a mentor to help you succeed and achieve your goals. We have a thriving co-op social program across our North American offices and create the space for you to network with and get to know our senior leaders. Looking for more information?

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
At Leap Tools, we are building the world's most advanced solutions for the interior décor industry. With customers in 80+ countries, our clientele includes Fortune 500 companies such as Home Depot, local retailers such as Alexanian's, and everything in between. We have been recognized as one of the fastest-growing tech companies by Deloitte for multiple years in a row, and we are looking for ambitious challenge-seekers to fuel our momentum and help us create an iconic global tech company.

About our product
Our technology lets you see products in your own room before you buy. Imagine you want to redesign your home and have been searching for new tiles for your kitchen, or a new rug for your living room. You definitely want to make sure it will look good in your space. We enable that through cutting-edge computer vision technology, presented in an extraordinarily simple and accessible way. Try our rug demo now! Simply upload a picture of your room using your mobile phone, and slide the rug under your coffee table: https://www.roomvo.com/rugdemo/

About You
You have a passion for solving complex problems and working on products used by millions of people. You like to understand the big picture when it comes to complex systems. You are not afraid to dive into the details and trace a request through dozens of calls. Join us and you will work directly with our talented engineering team to push our product to new heights.

About our Stack
JavaScript, Next.js, React/Redux
Python, Django, PostgreSQL, AWS

About our culture
  • We're a remote-first company that encourages our employees to work from where they're most productive.
  • We work in tight-knit teams to cultivate an ownership mentality.
  • We cherish curiosity and an obsession for details because we know these details are invaluable over the long run.
  • We're hyper-focused on our achievements and our ability to execute our promises. We act with urgency.
  • Your birthday (and our company's birthday) is a day off!

Take the Leap. Apply now.

Our demo, in case you missed it:

Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:
Job Responsibilities:
Huawei Canada has an immediate 8/12/16-month Co-op opening for an Assistant Researcher.
About the team:
Founded in 2012, the Noah's Ark lab has evolved into a prominent research organization with notable achievements in academia and industry. The lab's mission focuses on advancing artificial intelligence and related fields to benefit the company and society. Driven by impactful, long-term projects, the aim is to enhance state-of-the-art research while integrating innovations into the company's products and services, including LLMs, RL, NLP, computer vision, AI theory, and Autonomous driving.
About the job:
  • Dig deep into a fun Autonomous Driving topic, becoming a subject matter expert and driving innovation.
  • Utilize computer vision and generative AI techniques to track, reconstruct, and synthesize real-world images from vehicle sensor platforms.
  • Collaborate closely with our other researchers, exchanging knowledge and expertise to drive impactful discoveries in Autonomous Driving.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional team members, including regular attendance and participation in meetings and working groups.
Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
About Huawei
With 194,000 employees and operating in more than 170 countries and regions, Huawei is a leading global creator and provider of information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure and smart devices. Integrated solutions span across four key domains - telecom networks, IT, smart devices, and cloud services. Huawei is committed to bringing digital to every person, home and organization for a fully connected, intelligent world.

About Huawei Canada
Huawei Canada focuses on fundamental research and development aimed at solving complex technical problems in emerging technologies like 5G, AI, Human Computer Interaction and Autonomous Driving. With ongoing research initiatives with 10 Universities across Canada and strategic collaboration agreements with several Universities, we support Canada's rich research community. In 2020, Huawei Canada ranked among the Top 20 corporate R&D investors in the country with a huge 40% increase in R&D investment year over year. Huawei Canada was established in 2008 and now has a total workforce of 1,200 in our six research centers across Canada.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Excellent coding skills with Python and/or C++
  • Familiarity with deep learning frameworks such as Pytorch and Tensorflow
  • Familiarity with Linux
  • Solid understanding of core concepts, including linear algebra, probability theory, optimization, computer vision, and machine learning
  • Experience in one or more focus areas: Computer Vision, Deep Learning, Robotics, State Estimation
  • Hands-on experience with real-world robotic platforms is an asset
  • Apply

Job Posting Information.Compensation and Benefits: Salary: $18.84 to $28.30 per hour (depending on professional experience).
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:
The following tasks will be assigned during the internship:
  • Perform assessments of key reanalysis variables, including snow depth, snow water equivalent, air and dew point temperatures, wind speed, soil moisture, and river flow, across different regions.
  • Compare these variables with observational datasets and analyze the accuracy of the reanalysis products.
  • Document the use of these evaluation tools from the user's point of view, so that they can be used more easily in the future.
Depending on the student's expertise and progress, the following tasks may be assigned to further refine the evaluation process or address emerging needs in model assessments:
  • Contribute to the development of evaluation scripts for CaSR-Land and CaSR-Rivers, ensuring they are user-friendly and require minimal configuration parameters.
  • Optimize these scripts by incorporating existing internal tools such as EMET, snow_eval, soil_water_content, and rivers_eval_mntr into a coherent framework for evaluating outputs.
  • Improve visualization tools for the performance of metrics or for monitoring reanalysis production.
Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
In recent years, ECCC has been working on the design, improvement and dissemination of a surface and precipitation reanalysis (CaSR) product that covers North America for the last four decades. Although this Canadian reanalysis dataset is gaining in accuracy and popularity over time, CaSR is not (yet) intended to directly provide results for soil variables and hydrology, but focuses on providing high-quality forcing for more advanced surface and hydrological models. In this context, the CaSR-Land and CaSR-Rivers by-products have been developed to provide a more accurate representation of surface and flux reanalyses, using more sophisticated assimilation and modeling approaches.

This project focuses on the use and full documentation of the evaluation tools used for the CaSR-Land and CaSR-Rivers reanalysis systems. The main objective is to evaluate the reanalysis products by assessing key variables, including snow depth, snow water equivalent, air and dew point temperatures, wind speed, soil moisture and river discharge. In addition, the student will create detailed documentation of the entire assessment process to ensure clarity and reproducibility for future users.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:
About Us
Tarteel was founded with one mission: to strengthen the relationship Muslims have with the Quran. This goal has been at the very heart of Tarteel since its creation, and we continue to strive to provide the proper tools to empower the Muslim ummah to better connect with the words of Allah SWT, nourishing their faith in doing so.

Inspired by the Islamic Golden Age, we saw untapped potential in the area of religious technology. We built Tarteel to help Muslims improve their Quranic study using the best digital tools. The Quran is a journey, and Tarteel is your companion.

Tarteel has more than 10M downloads, state of the art models, and relationships with leading AI companies such as Nvidia, who has us as a featured customer: https://www.nvidia.com/en-us/case-studies/automating-real-time-arabic-speech-recognition/.

What we're looking for
Tarteel is looking for an engineer that will help us serve the next 100M+ Muslims seeking to improve their recitation of the Quran around the world. To achieve this goal, our backend systems must be reliable, scalable, and highly performant. Our backend stack is composed of Django (Python) and Node.js, and we need someone who can help us both improve our existing codebase, as well as build new features to meet the needs of both our customers and internal stakeholders.

If you enjoy building APIs, systems, and tools that impact millions of users around the world and improve the productivity of engineers shipping code, apply to this role!

  • 1+ years of experience in backend or full-stack development
  • Knowledge of TypeScript (or JavaScript), with relevant experience using backend JS frameworks (ex. Express, uWebSockets)
  • Knowledge of Python, with relevant experience using backend Python frameworks (ex. FastAPI, Django, Flask)
    • Experience with Django is a plus
  • Solid knowledge of version control systems (e.g. Git)
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to work independently and in a team-oriented environment
